programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An Ibiza club DJ plans to take her act beyond the shores of the party island, but needs funds to push herself into the global limelight, and hopes the sale of her designer goods will give her the money she needs to achieve her ambition. Enter handbag specialist Claudia, James Constantinou's fiancee, who offers the customer a big surprise. Meanwhile, Alicja gets excited when she claps eyes on a vintage gold and diamond timepiece, and Prestige boss James hopes to recoup his losses when an unredeemed Aston Martin goes to auction.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers in London. The programme's youngest-ever house-hunter, 18-year-old student Claire Winship, has had cerebral palsy from birth and uses a wheelchair. With a budget of £1.7million, she wants a property with good investment potential, plenty of accessible space and a view of the Thames. Meanwhile, trainee fashion buyer Geri and her carpenter boyfriend Arran are looking for a one-bedroom flat near Crouch End in north London, and have £280,000 to spend.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Steve Greenbaum goes undercover among the workforce of his company PostNet, which offers design, printing and shipping services to small businesses. Posing as a failed motorcycle shop owner, he tries to find out how his staff are responding to firms that have been hit by the global recession.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Bridgeport, Connecticut, to visit Cafe Tavolini, which is being neglected by husband and wife managers teetering on the edge of divorce. The estranged couple's two children are struggling to save the business from their parents' disputes, and the visiting chef tries to shock the pair into stopping the restaurant from becoming a casualty of their quarrel.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Highlands Pub in Blackpool, where managers Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson are all about value for money.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dry-cleaning manager Valerie hosts the first dinner party in Lancashire, where she plans to impress her guests with a lamb hotpot and trifle. However, it remains to be seen whether her warm-hearted hospitality will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize by the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance teacher Nicky hosts the second night in Lancashire, where she hopes to impress her guests with a round-the-world themed menu inspired by her dancing tours, which includes a Chinese salmon starter, and an American dessert. However, with fellow contestant Peggy born in the United States, the host may have her work cut out in presenting the perfect dish.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Outsourcing manager Steve hosts the third night in Lancashire, where the 51-year-old plans to wow his guests with a `man of the world' menu that relies heavily on strong Indian spices. Peggy picks him up on his shop-bought black pudding, while Nicky is unimpressed by the mildness of the chicken balti, resulting in a humiliating chilli-sauce challenge.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: American Peggy hosts a USA-themed dinner party on the fourth night of the competition in Lancashire, and hopes her Arizonan recipes will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize. Her menu comprises tried and tested dishes, including her dessert of peach dump cake. However, friction between her and fellow contestant Steve continues to build.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final dinner party in Lancashire, and the turn of sales manager Andy to host. He is confident in his locally sourced gastro menu and delivers a meal with plenty of flair, but faces the challenge of impressing foodie Nicky. He is also under pressure to convince American Peggy of the merits of the region's food, while his fellow Lancastrians Valerie and Steve are keen to see how the area has influenced his cooking.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Single mother Jo Beck wants to move her family to Derby, despite her children being happily settled in Nottingham. Phil Spencer helps her decide if relocating is the right choice and searches for a suitable home. Also in Derby, Kirstie Allsopp offers advice to outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John Fairfield, who are looking for a property with a large garden, storage space for their sporting equipment and no noise from nearby roads.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps mother and daughter Rhona Brennan and Nina find the perfect family holiday home that could also work as a B&B in the French region of Limousin.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: New series. Professor Noel Fitzpatrick, Steve Jones and Kate Quilton host an appeal running every night until Friday as they embark on a quest to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, attempting to encourage people to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part and the team will be helping would-be pet owners find their perfect playmate. In the first edition, singer Leona Lewis shares her love of giving shelter animals a second chance in life.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Alcorn family in Peebles in the Scottish Borders. The family of four lives in a conservation area and while dad Dave loves their grey-stone Victorian villa for its picture-book charm, mum Amy despises its lack of practicality. With no off-road parking, no third bedroom and no downstairs bathroom - not to mention the small, draughty kitchen - she has quite a list. Would it be best to simply move on to one of the new properties picked out by Phil, or can Kirstie come up with a way of making their home work?.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Over the last decade, incidents of violence perpetrated by young men have risen by 22% and this edition examines the stories behind some of these calls and crimes. In Swindon, officers Emily Grigor and Simon Sanghera are called to arrest a man in his early twenties who has ripped off his top in a drunken rage before putting his fist through a wall and his foot through a window in a bar.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz as Sean Lock and David O'Doherty compete against Jon Richardson and Natasia Demetriou. John Kearns joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Get a House for Free
programme.desc: Landlord Marco Robinson - who owns a business and property empire worth £25million - is looking to give away a three-bedroom flat in Preston, worth around £120,000. Cameras follow him as he seeks the right person or people who he thinks will benefit most from the property.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Part one of two. For six weeks, 10 four year olds will share their classroom with 11 pensioners. In an experiment led by three geriatric specialists, the young and older group follow the same timetable in a new nursery set within a retirement village near Bristol. The senior group will undergo tests to measure mood, memory and mobility during their daily interaction with the kids.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds
programme.desc: Ten four year olds are half way through an ambitious six-week experiment, as they share their classroom with 11 pensioners who all follow the same timetable in a nursery near Bristol. Has the energy and activities of the younger group had a measurable impact on the pensioners? Can this ambitious experiment transform the way Britain cares for its increasingly older population?.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: New juror Michael imposes his larger than life personality on the group, while Matt begins to show a darker side.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: An international deal for James Constantinou on a wine collection in Lanzarote may be worth a million Euros, and a couple look to sell their one-of-a-kind house boat. Elsewhere, a gastro pub owner wants to take a loan out against a £250,000 Bentley, and James considers a risky deal on an unusual giant gemstone. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James heads to Ibiza to appraise a luxury speedboat worth over £100,000 and a diamond ring, while Lawrence values a piece of boxing memorabilia. Designer handbag expert Claudia must brush up on her history when she is confronted with a rare purse.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp revisits Aberdeenshire couple Karen and Russell, discovering they are not living in the property she found for them, but instead inhabiting a place they could never have imagined possible. In Buckinghamshire, Phil Spencer finds out how house-hunters Andrew and Emma, who had £625,000 to spend, are getting on in their new home.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jim Rogers, chairman and CEO of Kampgrounds of America, goes undercover within his own company to discover whether his employees share his boy-scout philosophy. However, Jim's wife Sandy fears his naturally outgoing and cheerful nature could undo his cover story as a recently unemployed reality show contestant.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Oceana, a restaurant in the heart of New Orleans, to try to change the fortunes of a business run by two quarrelling brothers. The chef soon discovers that the ingredients are of poor quality and could pose a health hazard, but he struggles to make his point with the owners without causing an even bigger conflict between them.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the White House in Brighton for the third day of the competition, where hosts Sean Edlin and Kathryn Turnbull run a laid-back seaside B&B. Denise and Jackie think the rooms are not well equipped and Marianne finds them clinical, while Mike and Neal are unsure about the price. Tensions are temporarily alleviated by a visit to the famous Theatre Royal, but Marianne and Deina continue to cause trouble at dinner. In the morning, a locally sourced breakfast impresses some of the guests, but the group must decide whether they are getting value for money.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business manager Alison Bennett hosts the first dinner party in Glasgow, where she hopes that her Thai menu of chicken satay, red-roasted pork and chili chocolate combs will help to secure her the £1,000 prize. However, it remains to be seen whether any of her guests are able to use the chopsticks she has provided.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Butcher Graeme Curley hosts the second night in Glasgow, where he has planned a meaty menu complete with pork ribs. He hopes to wow his guests by serving steak - and by bringing some of his trade to the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Michelle Blackett is the host on day three in Glasgow, and hopes to impress the diners by preparing a menu of exceedingly well-appointed food. Over the course of the evening, Michelle's guests discover her hidden heritage, and hospitality student Erwin - who speaks five languages - does his best to add the `Glaswegian' dialect to his arsenal.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ballet enthusiast and hospitality management student Erwin Orduz hosts the fourth dinner party in Glasgow and hopes to impress his guests with an evening of shocks and surprises. He attempts hotel-style presentation and serves up his meals in a dining room that has been decorated with a menagerie theme of animals and nakedness.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Yvonne Finlayson hosts the final night of the cooking competition in Glasgow, offering her guests a combination of `scientifically-infused' food, high-octane entertainment and scintillating chat - plus a healthy dose of revelations - to try to claim the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer assist two couples in their search for homes in Hertfordshire. Newly engaged accountants Liz and Neil are hoping to raise a family near the town of Tring, while in St Albans, married couple David and Claire want to find a place where they can finally settle down, after moving house five times in five years.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Wiltshire residents Peter and Karen Greaves find a property for £50,000 or less on Spain's Costa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Comedian Dom Joly reveals what happens to micro pigs when they grow up, while Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Noel Fitzpatrick return as they continue to try to find permanent homes for animals at the Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter. They also attempt to rehouse a whole host of pets from other rescue centres around the UK.(n)

programme.title: Old People's Home for 4 Year Olds

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: Diana: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary featuring never-before-seen footage of Diana, Princess of Wales, recorded by her speech consultant between 1992 and 1993 as she sought to define her public persona and present her own version of events reported in the press, touching on her marriage and experience of public life. The programme also features in-depth interviews with people close to her.(n)

programme.title: Rich House, Poor House
programme.desc: Families from opposite ends of the wealth and class divide swap homes, budgets and social status for seven days to discover how the other half lives. The Bentleys from Lincolnshire trade places with the Carter-Begbie family from Stamford. The Bentleys rank in the top 10 per cent of Britain's wealthy, and live in a large four-bedroom house with three bathrooms, two reception rooms, a top-of-the-range kitchen, conservatory and games room. The Carter-Begbies live in a rented three-bedroom house and have a weekly budget of £140. This week, however, that will rise to almost £1,800.(n)

programme.title: Mr Deeds

programme.title: Hamlet 2

Jennifer Aniston, Timothy Spall, Dominic West, Jason Bonham, Timothy Olyphant, Jason Flemyng(n)

programme.title: Hail, Caesar!
programme.desc: This outlandish comedy set in the golden age of showbiz centers on a slick Hollywood fixer named Eddie Mannix, who is pressed into action when a superstar actor is kidnapped and held for ransom. Mannix must race to quietly collect the ransom money before the gossip mags catch wind of the scandal(n)

programme.title: The Terminator
programme.desc: Endlessly imitated, The Terminator made the reputation of cowriter/director James Cameron -- who would go on to make 1997's titanic Titanic -- and solidified the stardom of Arnold Schwarzenegger. The movie begins in a post-apocalyptic 2029, when Los Angeles has been largely reduced to rubble and is under the thumb of all-powerful ruling machines. Kyle Reese (Michael Biehn), a member of the human resistance movement, is teleported back to 1984. His purpose: to rescue Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton), the mother of the man who will lead the 21st-century rebels against the tyrannical machines, from being assassinated before she can give birth. Likewise thrust back to 1984 is The Terminator (Schwarzenegger), a grim, well-armed, virtually indestructable cyborg who has been programmed to eliminate Sarah Connor. After killing two "Sarah Connors" who turn out to be the wrong women, he finally aims his gunsights at the genuine article. This is the film in which Schwarzenegger declared "I'll be baaaack" -- and back he was, in "kinder and gentler" form, in the even more successful Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)(n)

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Cantankerous Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski becomes a reluctant hero to his immigrant neighbours after saving them from a gang of hoodlums(n)

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: Max von Sydow stars in one of the most notorious horrors ever made as a priest battling to save a young girl from a demonic spirit. Ellen Burstyn and Linda Blair co-star(n)

programme.title: Rendition
programme.desc: Gavin Hood's thriller stars Reese Witherspoon as Isabella Fields El-Ibrahimi, the wife of American-Egyptian chemical engineer Anwar El-Ibrahimi. When Anwar disappears on his way home from a conference in South Africa, she is driven frantic trying to find proof of his whereabouts in the face of official denial. Anwar is being held as a suspected terrorist in secrecy in Marrakech, where CIA operative Douglas Freeman is reluctantly involved in his torture. Meanwhile, one of the torturer's daughters, Fatima, is secretly in love with a fellow student who may be following extreme paths. As Hood brings the strands together, the various characters' actions intertwine, moving towards a dramatic conclusion(n)

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: A betrayed mob hit man goes the lam with his son, and seeks revenge against vicious gangsters. As the bullets start to fly, the impressionable child is exposed to the goriest aspects of his father's talents in this gorgeously stylized action thriller(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul W.S. Anderson's turbo-charged, slam-bang tune-up of Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" follows the non-stop action taking place during a do-or-die contest pitting a convict (Jason Statham) against other cons, with the winner walking off with his freedom. Anderson admits to being "a big fan of the Corman movie," and this reworking is a glowing salute to Corman's original. Corman also serves as one of the film's producers, along with Anderson and Tom Cruise(n)

programme.title: From Hell
programme.desc: Johnny Depp stars in this intense psychological spin on the horrific legend of Jack the Ripper(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Director Peter Weir's first turn behind the camera since 1998's critically acclaimed The Truman Show, Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World is based on two Napoleonic War-era adventure novels in author Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, Master and Commander and The Far Side of the World. Russell Crowe stars as Captain Jack Aubrey, a high-seas adventurer who maintains a strong bond with ship-surgeon Stephen Maturin (Paul Bettany). After conquering much of Europe already, Napoleon's forces have set their sights on taking Britain, so Aubrey and the crew of his ship, the HMS Surprise, take to the Pacific to intercept any attacking ships from the French fleet. When Aubrey eyes a renegade French super-frigate, the Surprise pursues, leading to an adrenaline-charged chase through the distant reaches of the sea. Edward Woodall, James D'Arcy, and Lee Ingleby also star as members of the Surprise's crew(n)

programme.title: The Young Messiah
programme.desc: As his family travel from Egypt to Nazareth, a 7-year-old Jesus wishes to learn more about his identity and place in the world in this stirring biblical drama. Meanwhile, Herod Antipas dispatches a Roman centurion to kill the boy, whose miraculous powers might be a threat to his reign(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: In Alexander Payne's bittersweet comedy, two buddies, Miles and Jack, embark on Jack's stag week, a tasting trip around California's wine country, with oenophile Miles leading the way. Miles may be a wine expert but he's also a bitter divorcee, depressed and in love with a waitress, Maya, whose presence always leaves him tongue-tied. Jack is a faded actor who can't quite resign himself to marriage when there are still obtainable women in the world, married or not, and when he meets Stephanie at a tasting, he swears Miles to secrecy about the wedding. And so the foursome continue their trip... Alexander Payne's Oscar and BAFTA-winning road trip is a classic of friendship and crisis, with four outstanding leads(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Hilary Swank adds another outstanding characterization to her Oscar-winning résumé. She plays Holly Kennedy, a young widow whose late husband (Gerard Butler) arranged to have 10 letters delivered posthumously to encourage her to carry on with her life. Directed by Richard LaGravenese, who cowrote the moving script with Steven Rogers. The film is an adaptation of Cecelia Ahern's popular first novel, which she wrote when she was 21(n)

programme.title: Youth
programme.desc: Two longtime friends take stock of their accomplished artistic careers in this meditative drama written and directed by Paolo Sorrentino. Michael Caine stars as Fred Ballinger, a retired composer who, at the behest of his daughter (Rachel Weisz), is on vacation in the Alps with his friend Mick Boyle (Harvey Keitel), a filmmaker currently working on a new project. Fred believes he is enjoying his retirement, but he is soon approached with an offer of a British knighthood if he'll conduct a performance of a famous piece he wrote(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop
programme.desc: Arnie's at his best as tough L.A. detective John Kimble who must find a drug lord's wife so she can testify in court. Problem is, she's gone into hiding to protect her son. With only the name of the kid's elementary school, Kimble must go undercover... As a kindergarten teacher! Academy Award winner Linda Hunt joins the cast with Academy Award nominee Cathy Moriarty in this great blend of action, thrills, and humor(n)

programme.title: Three Kings
programme.desc: As the end of the first Gulf War nears, a group of adventurous American soldiers attempt to find a huge cache of hidden Iraqi gold(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman racked up an Oscar reprising his role from "The Hustler", a pool shark who takes a hotshot under his wing(n)

programme.title: Nine to Five
programme.desc: Colin Higgins' feminist comedy stars Jane Fonda, Dolly Parton and Lily Tomlin as three office workers stuck with an odious sexist pig for a boss. After her husband runs off with another woman, Judy Bernly must find work for the first time. Joining Consolidated Companies as a secretary, she is taken under the wing of super-efficient, long-time office manager Violet Newstead and fellow secretary Doralee Rhodes. The trio have the misfortune of working for Franklin Hart Jr - a first-class chauvinist, who will quite happily tip pencils on the floor just so he can ogle Rhodes' cleavage while she picks them up. When Newstead is unfairly passed over for promotion for the umpteenth time, the women head for Doralee's house to commiserate and smoke pot, which prompts revenge fantasies from each of them. But then fantasy blends with reality, and events spin out of control..(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.title: Rambo
programme.desc: John Rambo is living a quiet life as a recluse in the U.S. - until a young girl goes missing, and he abandons his quiet lifestyle and takes justice into his own hands. When missionaries in Myanmar disappear into the vast green inferno, vigilante Vietnam War veteran John Rambo leaves his job as a Salween River boatman behind to accompany a group of mercenaries on a daring rescue mission. It's been twenty years since Rambo traded his guns for a fishing reel, but the world's longest running civil war rages into its sixtieth year on the nearby Thai-Burma border. Now, despite the fact that Rambo has long since sworn off all forms of violence, the knowledge that innocent missionaries are being used as pawns in a brutal war leaves him with no other choice than to venture behind enemy lines on his most dangerous mission to date(n)

programme.title: Focus

programme.title: Goodfellas
programme.desc: Martin Scorsese directs this hard-hitting, highly-acclaimed contemporary gangster drama, based on the memoirs of a real-life Mafia 'wise guy'. Set on the streets of New York, the film follows the rise through the ranks of organised crime of Henry Hill, a small-time hustler who enters the sprawling crime organisation as a runner for neighbourhood don Paul Sorvino. Moving through the mob milieu, Hill comes into contact with veteran Irish hood Robert De Niro, who takes the youngster under his wing to teach him the unwritten rules of the underworld and impress upon him the value of loyalty to the members of his surrogate 'family'(n)

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in this affectionate remake of the British classic as Charlie Croker, who, after taking over from John Bridger as the leader of a gang of thieves, celebrates his new status with a multi-million-dollar job in Venice. But gang member Steve Frezelli double-crosses his friends, kills Bridger and leaves the rest for dead. The gang survive and Croker spends a year tracking the traitor, using the safecracking skills of Bridger's daughter Stella to rob Steve and avenge her father's death. F Gary Gray's all-action movie does, of course, include the famous Minis sequence, with several of the cast doing their own driving(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Academy Award-winning Exorcist director William Friedkin scuttles deep into the darkest recesses of the traumatized human psyche with this tale of a lonely bartender haunted by the long-ago disappearance of her young son, and the paranoia that emerges when she enters into a tentative relationship with a deeply disturbed drifter. Adapted from the off-Broadway play by Tracy Letts, Bug centers on Agnes (Ashley Judd), who tends bar alongside pal R.C. (Lynn Collins), and has recently moved into a shoddy roadside motel in hopes of avoiding her menacing and recently paroled ex-husband, Jerry (Harry Connick Jr.). Upon making the acquaintance of subdued former soldier Peter (Michael Shannon, repeating his stage role), a veteran of the first Gulf War, Agnes finally senses that things are looking up. Quietly charming despite his melancholy aura, Peter soon reveals to Agnes that he contracted a "bug" while serving in the Middle East, and that it may have been deliberately administered as part of a secret military medical experiment. Convinced that the microscopic insects are quickly multiplying just under the surface of his skin and that they have now infected Agnes as well, Peter soon descends into a psychotic rage as he resorts to increasingly desperate measures to purge himself of the offending subdermal arthropods(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: High-octane action thriller about a cop who goes undercover in Los Angeles's street-racing world in order to snare a villainous gang-leader(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: The mismatched cops variation of the buddy comedy genre gets taken out of mothballs for this farce directed by longtime Adam Sandler collaborator Dennis Dugan. Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star, respectively, as Earl Montgomery, a loudmouthed police academy reject, and Hank Rafferty, a mild-mannered cop who is disgraced and dismissed from his job. Having met once before on a traffic stop, the two men are less than thrilled to be paired together as security guards. When the two men discover a complex smuggling scheme, however, they put aside their animosity to investigate the criminal scheme. They soon learn that the illegal enterprise involves a mastermind named Nash (Eric Roberts) and a new, virtually indestructible metal that's worth a fortune. Unable to persuade Hank's former police department superiors that they're onto a huge case, the two partners must devise a way to expose the sophisticated scam and bring down Nash on their own. National Security co-stars Colm Feore, Bill Duke, Timothy Busfield, and Wayne Knight(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Mr. Right
programme.desc: Martha finally finds her Mr. Right, but he has just one flaw: he is a hitman on the run from his former employers, a crime cartel(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Undercover Brother is recruited by the secret organisation called the B.R.O.T.H.E.R.H.O.O.D. to foil the attempts of The Man to destroy racial unity(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Johnsons set out from California for a family reunion in Missouri. The parents are split up, the kids are arguing - can everyone keep it together for the big day?(n)

programme.title: The Martian
programme.desc: After an exploratory mission goes awry, lone astronaut Mark Watney (Matt Damon) is left for dead on the hostile surface of Mars and must use his scientific ingenuity to homestead an enclosed habitat where he can survive. Meanwhile, the astronauts he left behind realize the severity of his plight and join forces with an international coalition of scientists to launch a rescue mission in defiance of NASA protocol(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Humans and orcs clash in this film adaptation of the popular video-game series(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A mysterious artificial being evolves faster than anticipated, and a corporate consultant is enlisted to determine the test subject's fate(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: World Wrestling Entertainment superstar Kane gives a killer performance as a deranged, hulking psychopath who terrorizes eight teens working to rehab a decrepit hotel. It's no-holds-barred mayhem as the murderer employs a variety of different weapons and instruments to dispatch his victims. Directed by Gregory Dark. WWE head Vince McMahon serves as executive producer. Steven Vidler, Christina Vidal, Michael J. Pagan, Samantha Noble, Cecily Polson, Luke Pegler, Penny McNamee, Craig Horner(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Takeoff on the Godfather with the son of a mafia king taking over for his dying father(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: A cop with little regard for the rules tries to track down a sniper who is murdering the innocent in San Francisco. It is up to Dirty Harry and his partner Chico to track him down(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror about a half-human, half-alien female mutant who escapes from a government laboratory and attempts to prolong the life of her species by mating with a human. Pursued by scientists and police, she passes through a chrysalid stage and takes on the appearance of a beautiful young woman. But she can also metamorphose from her eye-catching form into a repulsive, death-dealing monster(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi blockbuster. After becoming the first person on Mars, astronaut Patrick Ross is infected with spores of alien DNA, resulting in a dangerously inflamed libido and an outbreak of alien offspring. Elsewhere, the monster who wreaked havoc in the original film has been cloned and united with government assassins in order to track down Ross and eliminate the new species(n)

programme.title: Blow
programme.desc: Following the life of cocaine-trafficking pioneer George Jung in a way that recalls Martin Scorsese's Casino, Blow recounts the man's days from his 1950s childhood in Boston to his downfall in the 1980s. George (played by Johnny Depp) begins his life as the son of Fred (Ray Liotta), an earnest breadwinner, and Ermine (Rachel Griffiths), who frequently walks out on them in pursuit of a more fulfilling life. When George moves west to California in the late '60s, accompanied by best pal Tuna (Ethan Suplee), he becomes an entrepreneur in the marijuana business, which soon spreads to the East Coast as well, with girlfriend Barbara (Franka Potente) smuggling the product during her stewardess shifts. George is arrested in 1972 -- at which time Barbara dies of cancer -- but George finds a new ally in Diego (Jordi Molla), who proposes the idea that he become the American conduit for Colombian kingpin Pablo Escobar (Cliff Curtis). George flourishes in the heyday of the disco era, and falls for Mirtha (Penelope Cruz), a self-serving bombshell who eventually has a daughter with him. Trouble escalates as the FBI threatens to bring George and his crew down, while he desperately tries to be a stable parent to his young offspring. Blow also features Paul Reubens and Max Perlich in featured roles(n)

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: An Afghanistan War veteran living in London seeks revenge against his pregnant girlfriend's killer by assuming an upper-class identity and using his connections in the Chinese mob(n)

programme.title: The Mummy Returns
programme.desc: Daring adventurer Rick returns to Egypt for a second crack at evil high priest Imhotep. But this time, the devious shaman has enlisted the diabolical services of the Scorpion King and his army of a thousand jackal warriors(n)

programme.title: Waterworld
programme.desc: The Mariner (Kevin Costner) tries to rescue Enola (Tina Majorino) after she's captured by Deacon (Dennis Hopper)(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: In northern Australia at the beginning of World War II, an English aristocrat inherits a cattle station the size of Maryland. When English cattle barons plot to take her land, she reluctantly joins forces with a rough-hewn stock-man to drive 2,000 head of cattle across hundreds of miles of the country's most unforgiving land, only to still face the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by the Japanese forces that had attacked Pearl Harbor only months earlier(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: This riveting crime drama based on true events follows the rise and fall of South Boston gangster James "Whitey" Bulger, who was convinced by an FBI agent to act as an informant against the Italian mob. With his main competition out of the way, Bulger assumes power and becomes a feared crime boss(n)

programme.title: The Civil War: Brothers Divided
programme.desc: Battle of Bull Run. July 1861: In what will be the first real battle of the Civil War, untested and poorly trained Confederate troops clash on the blood-soaked banks of the Bull Run River in Virginia(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Alone (May 1940 - May 1941). Acclaimed documentary series telling the story of World War II, narrated by Laurence Olivier. With France fallen, the USA as yet uninvolved and the Russian pact with Hitler still in force, Britain stands all alone against the Germans forces across the English Channel(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Barbarossa (June - December 1941). Acclaimed documentary series telling the story of World War II, narrated by Laurence Olivier. The pact between Germany and the Soviet Union outwears its usefulness, and Hitler turns his tanks and troops against Russia. After a succession of devastating victories, the Germans delay fatally, and the fierce Russian winter takes a grip(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Banzai!: Japan (1931-1942). This video is part six in the 26-volume World at War series that chronicles the history of World War II. Hosted by Laurence Olivier, the programs originally aired on television in 1974. In this episode, the story of Japanese aggression leading up to the attack on Pearl Harbor is told. Archival film footage shows the Nanking Massacre, as well as events in the Philippines, Singapore, and Hawaii(n)

programme.title: Warrior POV
programme.desc: Road to Baghdad. The fall of Baghdad in 2003 during the Iraq War is examined(n)

programme.title: Warrior POV
programme.desc: Beheading the Taliban. U.S. Army Special Forces battle the Taliban nearKandahar, Afghanistan, for control of high ground at Sperwan Ghar in September 2006(n)

programme.title: Warrior POV
programme.desc: Screaming Eagles in Afghanistan. In 2010, the "Screaming Eagles" of the 101st Airborne Division face off against the Taliban during Operation Dragon Strike(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: The Hunt for Che Guevara. The search for Che Guevara by Bolivian special forces in 1967 is supervised by CIA agent Felix Rodríguez(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: Killing Mad Dog Gaddafi. Top-secret missions by the Central Intelligence Agency are examined in this series, which begins with a look at the revolt against Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi (1942-2011) that had allegedly been planned for three decades(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: The Deadly Phantom Coup. The CIA staged a coup d'etat in Guatemala in 1954, tricking the country into believing a huge invasion was taking place(n)

programme.title: CIA Declassified
programme.desc: Operation Celestial Balance. Lifting the lid on espionage operations. After the bombing of the US embassy in Nairobi, the CIA bribe warlords to track down suspected Al-Qaeda fighters(n)

programme.title: Top Secret Weapons Revealed
programme.desc: Secret Weapons of D-Day. A look at Allied weapons designed to overcome German defenses on the beaches of Normandy on June 6, 1944(n)

programme.title: Top Secret Weapons Revealed
programme.desc: The Flying Soldier. An examination of the U.S. Army's efforts to give individual soldiers the ability to fly, including the use of rotor blades, rocket packs and jet engines(n)

programme.title: Top Secret Weapons Revealed
programme.desc: Nazi War Machines. A look at Nazi plans during World War II to develop a number of revolutionary weapons, including massive artillery and tanks, a "flying wing" and the use of rocket power(n)

programme.title: Top Secret Weapons Revealed
programme.desc: Weapons of the Superspies. Cold War spy technology is developed to wage a war of espionage between the U.S. and the Soviet Union(n)

programme.title: Top Secret Weapons Revealed
programme.desc: Seaplane Strike Force. A look at the race during the Cold War to develop a seaplane capable of transporting troops and armored vehicles, and evading enemy radar(n)

programme.title: World War II: Confidential
programme.desc: Unlikely Friends. The backroom dealings of Winston Churchill, Franklin D. Roosevelt and Joseph Stalin during WWII are explored in this series, which begins with the Nazi-Soviet Pact of 1939 and Germany's termination of it with Operation Barbarossa in June 1941(n)

programme.title: World War II: Confidential
programme.desc: Hitler's Betrayal. Soviet-British relations; the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor; and plans for a Western Front in Europe are examined(n)

programme.title: World War II: Confidential
programme.desc: Cracks in the Alliance. Features the Moscow Conference between Stalin and Churchill and two battles on the Eastern Front: Stalingrad and Kursk(n)

programme.title: World War II: Confidential

programme.title: Holby City

programme.title: Trust Me

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: As the Gibraltar locals reel from the murder of shipping agent Gordon Fletcher, Brian and Gerry - last seen being carried off in a shipping container - find themselves stranded on the side of a Spanish mountain, and now face the problem of how to get back to the rest of the team. As Sandra attempts to unravel secrets stretching back over three decades and link what has now become three murders, she still has doubts about the innocence of charming entrepreneur Harry Truman - but that doesn't stop her joining him for lunch on his luxury yacht. Conclusion of a two-part story, with regulars Amanda Redman, Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson joined by Vincent Regan and George Irving.(n)

programme.title: The Bug Grub Couple
programme.desc: Entomologist Sarah Beynon and chef Andy Holcroft embark on a mission to bring insect-based food into the mainstream, promoting it as a more sustainable source of protein than meat. Before pitching to potential buyers, they go to the Netherlands to check that the insect farmers there can supply the quantity and quality of protein that they need and that it is safe for human consumption. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright sheds light on more counterfeit operations that have left consumers dissatisfied. This time, he reports on fake hoverboards that have caught fire in people's homes, and sophisticated copies of high-street jewellery, which are marketed as being silver, but actually contain no silver at all.(n)

programme.title: Super Small Animals
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates the world of miniature creatures, from a primate no bigger than a mouse to a chameleon that can fit on a human fingertip, finding out what makes them some of the most successful animals on the planet. He reveals how the smallest armadillo manages to control its temperature in the searing desert sun, and meets a scientist who studies how really tiny spiders have a surprising trick that enables them to travel an incredible 40 miles a day using almost no energy.(n)

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part one of two. Anita Rani examines the stories of four British families, one Muslim, one Hindu, one Colonial and her own Sikh one, who lived in India at the time of Partition in 1947, when the country was divided and created the new nation of Pakistan. They travel for the first time to the homes in Pakistan, India and Bangladesh that their relatives fled in terror, meeting long-lost family friends, and neighbours of other religions who shielded their families at huge personal risk.(n)

programme.title: My Big Gay Jewish Conversion
programme.desc: Simon Atkins goes on a personal journey as a gay man to discover if he could convert to Judaism, and whether it is worth sacrificing his Catholic upbringing. He starts with a trip to the local Rabbi, before heading to Judaism's homeland, Israel, and explores the streets of Tel Aviv. Simon then heads to Jerusalem, where extreme views towards homosexuality are rife.(n)

programme.title: I'm Coming Out
programme.desc: Tired of feeling like he lives a double life and having to hide his bisexuality, 19-year-old Owen decides to come out to his parents on camera. He finally builds up the confidence to tell his mother, who in a life affirming moment tells him he no longer has to hide his true sexuality from her. But he still has to tell his father, which is a prospect he is far more nervous about.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Sherlock and Mr Selfridge actress Amanda Abbington joins host Brian Conley to look back at the classic television shows that shaped her into the person she is today. She reflects on how watching her favourite children's programmes alongside her mother gave her a chance to showcase her talent for accents, and confesses that she cannot bring herself to watch horror films when husband and fellow actor Martin Freeman is away from home.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Jean Johansson tries to get the Siberian tigers to cool off in their pool, Kate Humble finds out why Longleat's pelican expert has won a major award and Ben Fogle meets some lemurs.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt help two teams buy three items at Wetherby Racecourse, while presenter Eric Knowles also visits one of the world's oldest sweet shops.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Documentary celebrating inspirational agricultural families and the events where they showcase their hard work. Dairy farmers Ben and Holly from Eynsford, Kent, come up against neighbour and friend Trevor from Guston at the Edenbridge & Oxted Agricultural Show in Surrey.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest Judy Murray - mother of British number one tennis player Andy - as the programme continues its Wimbledon-themed series.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores some of the most spectacular and scary sea cliffs in Britain.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold presents action from the opening Super 8 and Qualifier fixtures, including Leeds Rhinos v Wigan Warriors and Castleford Tigers v St Helens.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner visit Somerset, where Brian rustles up a grilled wild boar fillet with roasted beetroot and cumin at the county's highest point - Dunkery Beacon. Janet explores the three eras of landscape gardening at Hestercombe Gardens, including the design collaboration of Edward Lutyens and Gertrude Jekyll. Local chef Brett Sutton serves up local lamb and black garlic, before the presenters visit the Haynes International Motor Museum. Plus, Brian prepares the celebration dish of baked apples with cider caramel sauce.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: The documentary offering a glimpse into the rarely seen South American wilderness continues, this time following the path of the relentless wind sweeping east through Patagonia's dry desert from the Andes' peaks. The programme reveals a weird world of maras - a large relative of the guinea pig - and penguins, and witnesses the first faltering steps of baby guanacos - Patagonia's very own camels. Cameras also observe the people who have taken on this inhospitable environment and carved out a home for themselves. Santiago Cabrera narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough swims alongside sea otters, discovering he is no match for their natural agility in the water, while in Florida he takes a dip with manatees for the first time and observes their feeding habits. On the coast of California, he encounters the largest mammals on the planet, blue whales, and reveals how they, along with porpoises and dolphins, learned to court, mate and give birth in the water.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Mark Stacey and Will Axon travel through Kent in their search for bargains, beginning in Bilsington before battling it out at auction in Sandwich. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc in which pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords as they attempt to take home the £2,500 prize money. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the fifth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the finals of five events. Injury had prevented David Rudisha from defending his 800m but a high-quality race is still expected, while world record-holder Wayde van Niekerk is the man to beat in the 400m final. Medals are also decided in the women's javelin, and men's 3000m steeplechase and pole vault. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Jimmy Carr and the Science of Laughter - A Horizon Special.
programme.desc: The comedian takes over the science programme in a special episode for BBC's sitcom season, turning it into a chat show with eminent scientists as guests. He talks to them about the nature of laughter, with the studio audiences serving as guinea pigs in his attempt to get to the bottom of what laughter is, what it has to do with comedy, and why human beings find it a pleasurable sensation. The programme reveals that laughter predates the human species and may have played a vital role in our evolution.(n)

programme.title: 10 Puppies and Us
programme.desc: Documentary following young dogs and their new owners over the course of their all-important first six months together. The first episode features Chihuahua Chloe, setting up residence in an east London nail salon. She immediately wants to befriend 10-year-old Rocky, formerly top dog in the household, but Rocky is not interested. Meanwhile, border collie Jura joins a ski patroller in the highlands of Scotland, rescue pup Pedro arrives in the Surrey countryside from Spain and golden retriever Lola joins Hampshire family the Payes.(n)

programme.title: Jodi's Lovely Letters
programme.desc: Aled Jones meets Jodi Ann Bickley, who has ME and has established the project One Million Lovely Letters in 2013. Since then, the Birmingham resident has been dubbed `the girl who writes letters' after submitting thousands of missives to people around the world, offering support to those who need it. Part of the One Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: The Donnelly family from rural County Armagh are thought to be the oldest group of siblings in the world. Angela Scanlon meets them as they attempt to get a world record. Part of BBC One's Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Brian Conley invites Anita Dobson to pick the shows that shaped her life, with her selection including Television Dancing Club and clips of Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers in action.(n)

programme.title: Animal Park Summer Special
programme.desc: Cameras follow a penguin love triangle at Longleat Safari Park in Wiltshire, while Kate Humble and Ben Fogle meet three male gorillas, and Jean Johansson oversees bathtime for emus.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Hay-on-Wye is the location as a husband and wife take on a father and son, with help from Paul Laidlaw and Kate Bliss. Presenter Natasha Raskin also shows a very curious antique.(n)

programme.title: My Friend Jane
programme.desc: Documentary shedding light on the lives of Jane Austen super-fans, who read, live and breathe all-things Regency. While Austen's works are often considered genteel romances, they are often shot through with acid-sharp wit, social commentary, and a hint of biography, with certain elements from her famous novels more than mirroring aspects of Jane's own life. Here, the self-professed `Janeites' share their thoughts on why they have fallen in love with Austen's genteel narratives, and explain what the work of a vicar's daughter from Hampshire who died 200 years ago means to them.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Scotland prepare starters, with returning chefs Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battling it out with newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. All three contenders take huge risks, with Ally making a ricotta that should take 24 hours to prepare, Michael attempting to impress with a vegan dish and Angela intriguing her fellow contestants with a savoury ice-cream dish.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner head to Oxfordshire to visit the UK's oldest botanic garden, before chef Mike North introduces the pair to a local pub game called Aunt Sally and serves a local dish to a victorious Janet. She uncovers the history of Broughton Castle and Brian visits Wykham Park Farm at the height of the asparagus season to pick his own produce and use it to prepare a salad with radish dressing. Then, at Cumber Farm he encounters its herd of veal cattle, which provides the key ingredient for his celebration cook.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Exploring the London's surprising and secret wildlife, including seals, parakeets, badgers, foxes and even pelicans who have made London their home. The programme also focuses on the admirers of these animals, from Billingsgate fish porters and Indian chefs to Crayfish Bob, who scours the canals for foreign species.(n)

programme.title: Patagonia: Earth's Secret Paradise
programme.desc: Life in the treacherous seas that surround the South American wilderness. The 4,000-mile coast stretches from the cold waters of Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins overcome huge challenges to raise their young - to the far north's much warmer climate, where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert. Orcas ram-raid the beaches, grabbing seal pups to feed their young, and fishermen are also incentivised to gather the sea's bounty. Narrated by Santiago Cabrera.(n)

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough profiles the tree-dwellers of the animal kingdom, as primates, bats and squirrels perform complicated manoeuvres in the world's forests. Whether aided by sharp claws, webbed feet or gripping tails, these animals play a complicated game of survival with predators lurking below, ready to make a meal of those who fail to stay aloft.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Beginning in the coastal town of Deal in Kent, Mark Stacey and Will Axon head west in search of collectibles, before battling it out at an auction in Chiswick, London. Each antiques expert will be hoping to make the most profit when their bargains go under the hammer.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the sixth night of events at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Allyson Felix will be chasing an incredible 10th World Championship gold in the 400m final this evening, while the likes of Kyron McMaster and Kerron Clement are expected to battle it out in the 400m hurdles final. In the field, the women's shot put final takes place and British medal hopeful Lorraine Ugen looks to qualify for the long jump final, while Mo Farah begins the defence of his 5,000m title in the heats. With analysis from Michael Johnson, Colin Jackson and Denise Lewis, commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Brendan Foster and Steve Backley, and reports from Ore Oduba.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jamie Bartlett investigates how technology companies are shaping the future of the world, and the potential negative consequences of the drive towards progress. He visits Hyderabad, where the utopian vision promoted by Uber has left many drivers on the brink of suicide, questions the impact of more jobs becoming automated, and meets a former executive who fears social breakdown and the collapse of capitalism.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe profiles the Bristol Channel pilot cutter, the design of which many sailors consider to be the perfect combination of form and function, and ideally suited to crossing one of Britain's most treacherous stretches of water.(n)

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.title: Utopia: In Search of the Dream
programme.desc: New series. Art historian Professor Richard Clay explores how the idea of utopia has been re-invented by generations of writers and artists. He also examines what utopian visions reveal about our deepest hopes, dreams and fears. Among the contrributors is Star Trek actress Nichelle Nichols.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Immortal? A Horizon Guide to Ageing.
programme.desc: Veteran presenter Johnny Ball looks back over the years that both he and TV series Horizon have been appearing on air to find out what scientists have learnt about how and why people grow old. He charts developments from macabre early claims of rejuvenation to the latest breakthroughs, and asks if the dream of immortality is any closer to coming true.(n)

programme.title: The Brain with David Eagleman
programme.desc: Neuroscientist David Eagleman takes viewers on a journey into the inner workings of the human brain, revealing how it affects thoughts, actions and beliefs.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Timeshift: How Britain Won the Space Race - The Story of Bernard Lovell and Jodrell Bank.
programme.desc: The story of how Bernard Lovell turned a field in Cheshire into a key site in the Space Race. Lovell and his telescope at Jodrell Bank enabled the the Americans and the Russians to track their competing spacecraft during the height of the Cold War. This put Britain at the forefront of radio astronomy, a new science which transformed knowlegde of space and provided the key to understanding the beginnings of the universe - the Big Bang.(n)

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: Immortal? A Horizon Guide to Ageing.
programme.desc: Veteran presenter Johnny Ball looks back over the years that both he and TV series Horizon have been appearing on air to find out what scientists have learnt about how and why people grow old. programme.title: Utopia: In Search of the Dream
programme.desc: New series. Art historian Professor Richard Clay explores how the idea of utopia has been re-invented by generations of writers and artists. He also examines what utopian visions reveal about our deepest hopes, dreams and fears. Among the contrributors is Star Trek actress Nichelle Nichols.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Boats That Built Britain
programme.desc: Tom Cunliffe tells the story of the LCVP, the Landing Craft, Vehicle, Personnel, which had a pivotal role in transporting troops during the Second World War, especially for beach landings. The writer and sailor goes aboard one of the few remaining examples to learn how this piece of machinery was developed and how it is best remembered for its part in D-Day. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Fair Isle: Living on the Edge
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary charting life on Britain's most remote inhabited island, which is home to 55 people and situated halfway between mainland Shetland and the Orkneys. A new couple settle in and adapt to island life, and cameras follow a family whose 11-year-old son has to leave home to board at secondary school on mainland Shetland.(n)

programme.title: In Search of Arcadia
programme.desc: Dr Janina Ramirez teams up with waterman and fellow historian John Bailey to explore the origins and ethos of the English Landscape movement, which sprang to life in the 12-mile stretch of the Thames between Hampton and Chiswick in the early 18th century. Devised by a group of writers, poets, artists and garden designers, the movement was inspired by the classical landscapes of antiquity, and the notion of Arcadia, an idealised land in which mankind lives in harmony with nature. Janina takes in some of the most famous examples of English Arcadian work, including Nicholas Poussin's painting Et in Arcadia Ego, and visits some of the movement's most notable landmarks, including Hampton Court Palace and Marble Hill House, and the view from Richmond Hill. Plus, John goes fishing on the Thames with Izaak Walton's Compleat Angler, which not only serves as a comprehensive guide to angling on the river, but also serves as a philosophical treatise on the Arcadian mindset.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Jane: Battle for the City
programme.desc: Documentary charting the impact of the work of Jane Jacobs, the journalist, author and activist whose incendiary book The Life and Death of Great American Cities sent shockwaves through the architectural and planning industries when it was published in 1960. Jacobs' book claimed that 20th-century urban planners were guilty of short-sightedness and intellectual arrogance in their pursuit of modernism at the expense of historic neighbourhoods across the US. This film explores how Jacobs famously championed this cause against `master builder' Robert Moses, whose urbanisation efforts in New York City stood in direct opposition to her ideals.(n)

programme.title: Scotland's Einstein: James Clerk Maxwell - The Man Who Changed the World
programme.desc: Professor Iain Stewart reveals the story behind James Clerk Maxwell, the Scottish physicist who has been dubbed as `Scotland's Einstein'. Despite his discoveries causing a revolution in physics and shaping the modern world, Maxwell is largely unknown outside his native land. Iain sets out to change that by celebrating his life, work and legacy, 150 years after his greatest work was published.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: A client asks Grace to design his restaurant, but with one condition - she must first fire Karen.
