programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen is showered with gifts by her old sparring partner Scott, but her mind is elsewhere. Meanwhile, Grace tries to ignore the passing of another uneventful Valentine's Day, but ends up falling for a greetings-card writer. American comedy, guest starring Jeff Goldblum and Edward Burns with Debra Messing and Megan Mullally.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank backs into Robert's patrol car, prompting Debra to ban him from driving the kids anywhere - and leaving Ray contemplating his dad's advancing years. American comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra hires a babysitter - whose subsequent popularity with the children leaves her quietly seething with jealousy. To make matters worse, Marie feels insulted because she was not offered the job. Comedy, starring Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Part one of two. A miserly pay rise for staff prompts Frasier to cross swords with station manager Kate, but a meeting between the two sees them engage in more than negotiations as emotions are put to the test. Comedy, guest starring Mercedes Ruehl.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Adventures of Bad Boy and Dirty Girl.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Kate and Frasier decide to take their relationship slowly, until their passion gets the better of them in the radio booth and their steamy encounter is broadcast over the airwaves - leaving the whole of Seattle trying to work out the identity of `dirty girl'. Comedy, guest starring Mercedes Ruehl, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Last Time I Saw Maris.
programme.desc: Niles reaches the end of his tether with Maris, and decides to retaliate - but she turns the tables by throwing him out and asking for a divorce. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny attempt to prove Sheldon wrong when he claims that he and Amy have a superior relationship. Meanwhile, Howard is nervous when Nasa asks him to throw the first pitch at a baseball game honouring National Space Day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's girlfriend Emily (Laura Spencer) gives Penny the cold shoulder when she learns about his past. Meanwhile, the guys debate investing in Stuart's comic-book shop and becoming part owners of the business. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish.
programme.desc: Homer eats a poisonous fish and fears he has only 24 hours to live. As the minutes tick by, he embarks on a frantic race to put his affairs in order and accomplish everything he ever wanted to do but never did. With the guest voices of Larry King and George Takei.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa joins Mensa and inspires the local intelligentsia to take over Springfield. Determined to build a better world, they decide to transform the town into a utopia - but go too far and cause a riot. With the guest voice of Stephen Hawking.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Phil and wife Ali kick off the Sheffield/Rotherham contest, while day two sees Erica and Nigel host a romance themed evening, before Stephen and husband Kevin host a classy menu.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James heads to Ibiza to appraise a luxury speedboat worth over £100,000 and a diamond ring, while Lawrence values a piece of boxing memorabilia. Designer handbag expert Claudia must brush up on her history when she is confronted with a rare purse.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Helen Fospero presides in Dictionary Corner, alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: New juror Michael imposes his larger than life personality on the group, while Matt begins to show a darker side.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Islington Mill B&B in Salford, where Joe Spencer and Louise Woodcock have an alternative hosting style as their drag alter egos.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Cardiff, and host Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings with a massive tasting menu.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family constructs a tennis court in the back garden and Bart becomes an expert player, much to the annoyance of a jealous Homer. Featuring the guest voices of Venus and Serena Williams, Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Hunter gets caught red-handed, while Holly and Cindy are suspicious about Dirk's actions. Leela plans an exciting day for her and Zack, but he is still feeling stressed.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Comedian Dom Joly reveals what happens to micro pigs when they grow up, while Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Noel Fitzpatrick return as they continue to try to find permanent homes for animals at the Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter. They also attempt to rehouse a whole host of pets from other rescue centres around the UK.(n)

programme.title: Get a House for Free
programme.desc: Landlord Marco Robinson - who owns a business and property empire worth £25million - is looking to give away a three-bedroom flat in Preston, worth around £120,000. Cameras follow him as he seeks the right person or people who he thinks will benefit most from the property.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: Analysis of events during the short lived 2016 reality show continues, and as three more people leave, for the first time the men significantly outnumber the women in the Scottish camp. Some of the men suggest they concentrate on the traditionally more 'male' roles, while declaring the more domestic roles should be done by the women.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: Best Before: Music on 4
programme.desc: New series. Dance music DJs perform sets in unusual locations, starting with Jackmaster who throws a secret event in Crossrail Roof Gardens, London.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Trying to prove the authenticity of the internet's most famous clips, including a futuristic head shave, the world's most idiotic selfie and a city in the sky. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Black Rock
programme.desc: Three women try to rebuild their lost friendship by exploring a deserted island they first visited as children. They befriend three hunters, but when one of them turns violent, they kill him in self-defence. The two remaining men want revenge, leaving the women facing a battle for survival. Thriller, directed by and starring Katie Aselton. With Lake Bell and Kate Bosworth.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: New series. In March 2016, 23 men and women left everyday life behind to live in a remote part of the Highlands, where they would be given the chance to start again and create a new society from scratch. Their first months were shown on Channel 4 in 2016 and this catch-up follows their remaining time in Eden, to find out how the dream turned into a nightmare as by the summer hunger was rife and divisions within the camp already becoming apparent as Anton and Raph separated themselves and continue building a winter camp in the woods.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to solve the problems of first-time buyers in north London. Kirstie tries to end the house-hunting misery of Ify Okoye, who has viewed 90 properties without success. Meanwhile, Phil assists a couple looking to settle down in England after six years abroad - but discovers their ambitions may put their budget under serious strain.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three homeowners in Bradford compete to sell their homes to a willing buyer, after visiting each other's homes and spending £1,000 on improvements. Rahima and Ali create space in their cramped kitchen, while Carrie Ann and George add warmth to their sterile ground floor and Ruth and Megan address the poor configuration of their upstairs.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits the Devon County Show, where she tries to impress the judges with scones and unconventional kumquat eclairs in the afternoon tea tent, which is famed for its competitive atmosphere.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Helen Fospero presides in Dictionary Corner, alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will accompanies Grace on her first date with Nick so that he can keep her in check. Meanwhile, Karen hatches an outrageous scheme to set Jack up with the neighbourhood bird enthusiast, but things do not go as planned. Guest starring Luke Perry.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will agrees to fire Karen's pastry chef - until he bakes a delicious love triangle for the three of them. Grace asks Jack to help launch Nick's scriptwriting career. American comedy, guest starring Ed Burns, with Eric McCormack and Megan Mullally.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray fears Debra will seek revenge after he embarrasses her at a school auction. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's mother Lois comes to stay with the family for a week, but seems to be more interested in her crossword puzzles than in Ray or the children. Katherine Helmond guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The prospect of Christmas with his son Frederick leaves Frasier panicking about what presents to buy him, and it takes a reminder from Martin about the festive spirit to keep him on the right track.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: It's Hard to Say Goodbye If You Won't Leave.
programme.desc: The psychiatrist realises the true depth of his feelings for station manager Kate, only for her to announce she is moving to Chicago. Kelsey Grammer and Mercedes Ruehl star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The psychiatrist suddenly realises he has a shortage of friends in Seattle, as most of his old ones are back in Boston. He announces on air he is looking for companionship and gets a lot more than he bargained for. Guest starring Griffin Dunne, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to revise for a work assessment during the girls' trip to Las Vegas, and Amy and Bernadette accuse her of spoiling their fun. Meanwhile, the guys try to invent something of scientific importance - but only come up with new ways to procrastinate. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny ask Howard and Bernadette for advice when they argue about money. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj try to find out whether they could survive a dark matter research expedition in a salt mine by attempting to simulate the conditions in a steam tunnel beneath the university. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A dejected Mr Burns tries to improve his public image by taking part in a series of lowbrow radio talk shows and bringing the legendary Loch Ness monster to Springfield. With the voice of Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer becomes his local baseball team's mascot and does so well that a Major League side recruits him to help revive its flagging fortunes. Unfortunately, it is not long before he is fired. With the guest voice of Tony Bennett.(n)

programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Car salesman Paul and his partner Sara, glamorous newlyweds Russell and Shane, and offbeat duo Janine and Neil compete to throw the best dinner party in Sheffield.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn

A female bodybuilder wants to sell jewellery so she can fund her new hobby, and a golf fanatic brings in a case of vintage wine.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Helen Fospero presides in Dictionary Corner, alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.desc: Third host Peter Morris welcomes guests to the Pebbles B&B in Seaton, Devon, but despite his breakfast award, not all of the guests are impressed by his culinary offerings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Hunter plans a surprise for Neeta, while the Donovans get an unexpected visit, and Marnie turns to Myra for support. Elsewhere, Cindy is in the throes of a manic episode after lying about getting her medication, but she is encouraged to speak to a doctor with Dirk, Holly and Alfie's support.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and Steve Jones host an appeal to rehome all the animals in Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter, attempting to encourage would-be owners to consider them first over buying a pet. Many more rescue centres across the country are also taking part, while Kate Quilton follows adoptions as they happen in real time.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: Eden
programme.desc: Boatman Anton and carpenter Raph find themselves ostracised by almost every other member of the Eden community, having built an isolated house in the woods. Anton bears the brunt of their frustrations and anger; as there is a widely-held belief that the pair are not contributing to the wider group, yet are using items earmarked for the whole community - something they deny. Oli decides to confront Raph and Anton - the resulting showdown boils over into a dramatic conclusion that changes the group for ever.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: Poppy Cat

programme.desc: Gibbs receives a call from his old friend Senator Patrick Kiley, who claims he is being framed for the murder of a naval commander, and seeks help to clear his name. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.desc: An attorney prepares to take on the biggest case of her career against a major pharmaceutical company, only for the lawyer who taught her everything she knows to be kidnapped. programme.desc: The Czech Republic Grand Prix. Action from the 10th round of the season, which was held at Masaryk Circuit in Brno. British rider Carl Crutchlow secured a narrow victory at this race last season, while Valentino Rossi finished second and Mark Marquez in third.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A woman struggling to walk and suffering from dizzy spells visits the surgery, and doctors worry that her rapid decline may be caused by a rare muscle wasting disease. Meanwhile, a patient dealing with chronic pain and fatigue is also treated, and a schoolgirl with a mysterious rash is examined by the doctors.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Highlights of the housemates' past 24 hours under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother as the celebrities cope with living under constant surveillance, with all the arguments and alliances, as well as the revelations in the diary room.(n)

programme.title: Make or Break
programme.desc: The couples continue to fight for their relationships on the Mexican love island. In this episode, David has a one-to-one sex therapy session, Elle realises that it is not only cheating Andy who has to change, and Nikita shares Stephen's dirty secret.(n)

programme.title: Football on 5: The Carabao Cup
programme.desc: Highlights from the first round of the tournament historically known as the League Cup, which included Birmingham City v Crawley Town, and Forest Green Rovers v Milton Keynes Dons.(n)

programme.title: Master Of The Drunken Fist: Beggar So
Auto Focus
programme.desc: Biopic examining the sordid secret life of Bob Crane, popular star of the 1960s sitcom "Hogan's Heroes". Based on the book "The Murder of Bob Crane", by Robert Graysmith(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: During a family camping trip at the Grand Canyon, a young boy (David Mazouz) stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground. He takes five sacred stones from there back to his suburban home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force. This tale of terror was directed by Wolf Creek's Greg McLean. Kevin Bacon, Radha Mitchell, and Lucy Fry star in a Blumhouse Productions film(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes
programme.desc: Tom Witzky is a regular guy whose life is turned upside down after he is hypnotised by his sister-in-law. Suddenly, his ordinary life is invaded with violent flashes of horrific images he cannot explain(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror about a half-human, half-alien female mutant who escapes from a government laboratory and attempts to prolong the life of her species by mating with a human. Pursued by scientists and police, she passes through a chrysalid stage and takes on the appearance of a beautiful young woman. But she can also metamorphose from her eye-catching form into a repulsive, death-dealing monster(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: A cornet player at a legendary 1920s-era Harlem nightspot gets caught in the orbit of a notorious gangster and his teenaged mistress(n)

programme.title: Dead Poets Society
programme.desc: A staid but well-respected prep school is enlivened by a newly-arrived, charismatic English teacher, who inspires his students with unconventional methods and philosophies(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.title: Ted 2
programme.desc: With the help of his best friend John, a sentient teddy bear named Ted fights to be legally recognized as a human so he can have a child with his new wife Tami-Lynn. This gut-busting comedy is a sequel to the 2012 surprise hit(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: Enterprising teenager Joel Goodsen turns his parents' house into a brothel when they go out of town on a trip(n)

programme.title: Miss March
programme.desc: Zach Cregger and Trevor Moore wrote, directed and star in this uproarious road romp about a young man (Cregger) who's been in a coma for four years and awakens to discover that his chaste high-school sweetheart is now a men's-magazine centerfold, so he sets off to reconnect with her and consummate their relationship. Moore plays his horn-dog best friend who is with him every step of the zany way. Raquel Alessi, Craig Robinson, Alexis Raben, Eve Mauro. Hugh Hefner has a cameo as himself(n)

programme.title: Ride Along 2
programme.desc: Friction continues between a rookie cop and his seasoned partner (who's also his future brother-in-law) in this sidesplitting action comedy. After discovering a mysterious flash drive during an arrest, the pair travel to Miami to hunt down a drug lord with the help of a savvy detective(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: Damien: Omen II
programme.desc: It is seven years after the events of The Omen, and in Don Taylor's sequel, Damien is now becoming aware of his destiny. His adoptive parents, Richard and Ann Thorn have sent him to military school where Sergeant Neff becomes his mentor and guardian, ensuring those who would harm the Antichrist will meet a swift and violent end(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: Classic sidesplittingly funny comedy stars John Belushi as the head of the delinquent Delta House fraternity that the dean of Faber College plans to rid his campus of(n)

programme.title: On Time
programme.desc: A woman who is running late for a job interview is forced to make a tough decision. A finalist in the Short Film Competition at the 2016 American Black Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A group of death row prison guards discover there's more to an unusual new inmate than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: After discovering the truth about their walled city and breaking down its oppressive faction system, Tris and Four lead a journey outside of Chicago to learn more about who has been manipulating their civilization. But once their group comes face-to-face with the society that turned their city into an enclosed experiment, secrets are uncovered that threaten the fate of humankind(n)

programme.title: Manhunter
programme.desc: Dark thriller about an ex-FBI forensic investigator who is called in to track down a brutal serial killer known as 'the Tooth Fairy'. To help him understand the mind of his quarry, he visits the prison which holds an old adversary of his - notorious serial killer Dr Hannibal 'the Cannibal' Lektor. But the investigation comes to threaten his sanity and the lives of his family(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A thief enlists the help of mythical Egyptian gods to overthrow a vicious ruler(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: Writer-director Paul W.S. Anderson's turbo-charged, slam-bang tune-up of Roger Corman's 1975 cult vehicle "Death Race 2000" follows the non-stop action taking place during a do-or-die contest pitting a convict (Jason Statham) against other cons, with the winner walking off with his freedom. Anderson admits to being "a big fan of the Corman movie," and this reworking is a glowing salute to Corman's original. Corman also serves as one of the film's producers, along with Anderson and Tom Cruise(n)

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despot's reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: In the third installment of this horror series about a night when all crime is legal, a former police sergeant (Frank Grillo) who refused to murder his son's killer must now act as the head of security for a presidential candidate (Elizabeth Mitchell) who wants to end "the Purge." Written and directed by James DeMonaco(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout
programme.desc: An ex-quarterback teams up with a down-on-his-luck PI whose quarry is murdered while he was supposed to be protecting her(n)

programme.title: As Above, So Below
programme.desc: A group of subterranean explorers encounter terror beneath the streets of Paris after descending into the city's ancient catacombs. Just when it seems their journey can't get any more nightmarish, the demons of their pasts strike back with a vengeance(n)

Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Moore plays his horn-dog best friend who is with him every step of the zany way. Raquel Alessi, Craig Robinson, Alexis Raben, Eve Mauro. Hugh Hefner has a cameo as himself(n)

The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Crime Family. The Mob is demystified in the A&E program American Justice: Crime Family. Host Bill Kurtis takes the viewer into the heart of the New York underworld to examine the long arms of the Genovese family. Started when Vito Genovese worked under Lucky Luciano, the notorious family has a firm grip on syndicated crime. A&E presents rare footage of the gangster clan and its shady leaders. For years, police have pursued the Genovese, but they remain frustratingly immune to arrest. Hear from the prosecutors who have made their capture a full-time job and the historians who will explain why the Genovese will never die(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.sub-title: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story
programme.desc: Dead Woman Walking: The Karla Faye Tucker Story. This documentary, part of the American Justice series from A&E, examines the Texas death penalty case of Karla Faye Walker. Narrated by American Justice host and producer Bill Kurtis, this episode goes inside the investigation of the two murders that Walker and her boyfriend Daniel Ryan Garrett committed. The trial of Walker is shown through exclusive footage. After the conviction, American Justice follows her through her daily life, showing her prison surroundings and talking with her about her crimes. Sentenced to death, while Walker was waiting to be executed, she became a born-again Christian. Her lawyers used this transformation as leverage to try to get her death sentence reduced to life in prison. Their attempts were unsuccessful and Walker was killed by lethal injection in February 1998. American Justice also shows interviews with lawyers and law enforcement professionals who knew Walker(n)

programme.desc: Mac and Neeta have a serious talk, and Tegan and Leela search for information on Courtney's baby. Meanwhile, Marnie tricks James into forgiving her with Myra's help and he invites her back to live with him.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: Brendan leaves the coach behind as the group heads to the Croatian island of Hvar, where some new arrivals make a big impression on the group.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon hires an attractive female assistant, but when she becomes interested in Leonard, Penny decides to mark her territory by sleeping with him. Meanwhile, Howard starts to lose his mind when his return from space is delayed another week. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon isn't pleased when his assistant Alex starts flirting with Leonard and has a word with her about it. Unfortunately, his comments are so inappropriate that he is accused of sexual harassment and sent to the university's human resources department, where he ends up dragging Leonard, Raj and Howard into trouble too. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: First Dates USA
programme.sub-title: Should I Try to Kiss You?.
programme.desc: High-powered executives try to squeeze some romance into their lives, two anxiety-ridden singles hope to meet their other halves, and a pair of siblings attempt a double blind date.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny worries about the consequences of spending the night with Raj, and Leonard's reaction confirms her worst fears. Meanwhile, Sheldon is more interested in the upcoming paintball competition, and tries to refocus the boys' attentions as they argue over the previous evening's activities. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, 'Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia(n)

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted--or rather, refereed--by boxing expert Max Kellerman, this lively cable-TV discussion show featured four sports columnists, each from a different part of the USA, discussing recent pro-athletic developments in a sort of electronic summit meeting. Kellerman determined how much time each of the columnists would be permitted to express his or her opinions--and he was harsh indeed, frequently limiting the discourse to ten seconds or less. At the end of the show, Kellerman would award points for the most cogent opinions and arguments, and also subtract points from contributors whom he determined had not effectively expressed themselves. The inagural episode of ESPN's Around the Horn was seen on September 30, 2002(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: An insight into the largely unexplored Southern Red Sea, which is teeming with marine life and home to some of the warmest waters on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: Scientists in Alberta look for the skeleton of a rare horned dinosaur, while in Saskatchewan a team find the fossils of the last dinosaurs to walk the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve's search for deadly animals takes him and the crew to South Africa to observe the great white shark, where he gets some fantastic views of the `king of the ocean' - and to demonstrate the team's hunting prowess, he has a special trick up his sleeve. Just as feared by many is the Cape Buffalo, known locally as the black-death. The presenter takes to the skies to track down a huge herd of this notoriously bad tempered bovine beast, before being charmed by the snake-stomping secretary bird.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Steve Backshall heads for Australia, encountering one of the country's deadliest snakes in Perth, diving with bottlenose dolphins and discovering the method used by pelicans to catch their supper.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.desc: An insight into the largely unexplored Southern Red Sea, which is teeming with marine life and home to some of the warmest waters on the planet.(n)

programme.title: Bahama Blue
programme.desc: Looking at the Sand Flats and the creatures that live there, including iguanas, stingrays and bottlenose dolphins.(n)

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Dino Hunt
programme.desc: Scientists in Alberta look for the skeleton of a rare horned dinosaur, while in Saskatchewan a team find the fossils of the last dinosaurs to walk the Earth.(n)

programme.title: Deadliest Tornados
programme.desc: Documentary examining the 2011 tornado season in America, which left a trail of destruction across the country and resulted in more than 550 deaths. Scientists are witnessed analysing the forces at work behind the outbreak, hoping their work could improve tornado prediction in the future. The programme also meets some of the people whose lives were upended by the storms and explains the preventative measures that can be taken to minimise the impact of such extreme weather events.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve's search for deadly animals takes him and the crew to South Africa to observe the great white shark, where he gets some fantastic views of the `king of the ocean' - and to demonstrate the team's hunting prowess, he has a special trick up his sleeve. Just as feared by many is the Cape Buffalo, known locally as the black-death. The presenter takes to the skies to track down a huge herd of this notoriously bad tempered bovine beast, before being charmed by the snake-stomping secretary bird.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: Explorer Paul Rose, environmentalist Philippe Cousteau Jr, maritime archaeologist Dr Lucy Blue and marine biologist Tooni Mahto base themselves in the Bahamas to explore the Atlantic. On the island of Andros, they go on a risky dive to discover what the oceans looked like 3.5 billion years ago, and investigate an underwater cave system thought to hold the remains of the first inhabitants.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Documentary picking up where the Walking with Dinosaurs series left off, imagining life on Earth 16 million years after dinosaurs became extinct. Kenneth Branagh narrates as computer graphics give a new lease of life to the creatures that battled for supremacy throughout this turbulent age. The first episode re-animates the `walking whale' and a fearsome half-tonne flightless bird known as a gastornis.(n)

programme.title: Walking with Beasts
programme.desc: Computer graphics give a new lease of life to the basilosaurus, a mighty carnivorous whale that occupied an ancient waterway connecting Asia to the Atlantic. Here it is seen desperately foraging for food to sustain its unborn calf, leading to a battle for survival against a rival species. Also featured is the andrewsarchus, a monstrous wolf-like mammal, and the large aquatic pig known as moeritherium.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall's journey brings him into contact with more candidates for his list of Earth's deadliest creatures - the paralysis tick, lace monitor lizard and redback spider.(n)

programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. programme.title: Stargate
programme.desc: An expert translates hieroglyphs on an ancient ring, which turn out to be a map to a portal to another world. The Army sends two men to pass through the stargate and report back what is on the other side(n)

programme.title: Spanglish
programme.desc: A Hispanic woman and her young daughter are thrown into the middle of a well-to-do but remarkably dysfunctional family in this comedy drama from writer and director James L. Brooks. Flor (Paz Vega) is a single mother who has struggled to support her daughter Cristina (Shelbie Bruce) working as a domestic in Mexico. Hoping to give her daughter greater financial security, Flor packs up their belongings and moves the family to California, but Flor refuses to surrender her Latino identity and opts not to learn English; meanwhile, Cristina quickly learns to speak the language fluently. Flor lands a high-paying job working as a housekeeper for Deborah Clasky (Téa Leoni); Deborah doesn't speak a word of Spanish, but this is hardly the most curious thing about their working relationship. A deeply troubled neurotic who has spent time in a mental hospital, Deborah is at once obsessed with her duties as a wife and mother and utterly clueless to her family's needs, and when she learns that Flor has a daughter, she insists that the girl move in with the Claskys. Flor, however, isn't so sure she wants Deborah Americanizing Cristina, especially when Deborah begins doting on the girl at the expense of her relationship with her own daughter, Bernice (Sarah Steele). Deborah's husband, John (Adam Sandler), is an oasis of loving calm and understanding in the midst of his chaotic family, and Flor becomes attracted to this man who shows no signs of the arrogant machismo she's accustomed to. But John's career as a chef is turned upside down when The New York Times gives his restaurant a four-star review, suddenly turning his small eatery into the "in" spot in Los Angeles. Meanwhile, Flor reaches the end of her patience when Deborah enrolls Cristina into an exclusive private school which Flor is certain will turn her into a typical American child and drive a wedge between Cristina and her mother. Spanglish also stars Cloris Leachman as Deborah's sharp-tongued mother(n)

The massive cover-up that ensues leads the duo from the desert of Texas to a remote outpost in the frozen wilderness before they discover the truth(n)

programme.desc: The Dagger. Chen launches a big event to promote Cam's shoe line, but his actual plan is to woo Cassie, while Cam's interactions with a reporter don't work out as he planned(n)

programme.title: Phantoms
programme.desc: Two sisters enter an isolated mountain town, only to discover that the entire population, save for the sheriff, his deputy and a history professor, has been ravaged by giant wormlike creatures who feed on human flesh. Based on the novel by Dean Koontz. Peter O'Toole, Rose McGowan, Joanna Going, Liev Schreiber, Nicky Katt, Ben Affleck(n)

programme.desc: An FBI agent suspects a Muslim ex-US Special Operations officer of being involved with terrorists in this complex espionage thriller(n)

Into his lap falls the mysterious Milla Jovovich, a woman created from an alien cell who may be the only hope the world has of salvation from an ever-approaching evil(n)

programme.title: Get Shorty
programme.desc: When a Miami-mob loan shark is sent to LA to collect a debt from a producer of low-budget films, he pitches him an idea for a picture instead of breaking his legs. Pretty soon the shark finds himself in his element with criminal predators of the Hollywood variety. This clever adaptation of Elmore Leonard's novel features cameos from Harvey Keitel and Bette Midler, and a sparkling score from John Lurie(n)

programme.title: Masters of the Universe
programme.desc: Dolph Lundgren stars in this live-action film version of the popular television cartoon series (based on a collection of Mattel action figures). Lundgren is He-Man, a well-muscled super-hero, battling the evil Skeletor (Frank Langella) for control of the universe. Skeletor has designs on conquering the planet Eternia, a ravaged utopia ruled over by the Sorceress of Greyskull Castle (Christina Pickles). He-Man is summoned to stop Skeletor's plans. But when the wily dwarf Gwildor (Billy Barty) utilizes his Cosmic Key, He-Man and Skeletor finds themselves transported to California. There, a waitress named Julie (Courteney Cox) and her boyfriend Kevin (Robert Duncan Mitchell) come across the Cosmic Key and become embroiled in the intergalactic battle between He-Man and Skeletor(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: In a case with clear echoes of classic film 12 Angry Men, Adrian is summoned for jury duty - and manages to solve a murder while shut off from the outside world in a locked room. For good measure, he also thwarts a mobster planning to escape from police custody in the same building.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Asylum.
programme.desc: The police find Adrian wandering round his dead wife Trudy's former home and have him admitted to a psychiatric hospital, where a fellow patient informs him of an unsolved murder dating from four years earlier - which he naturally sets out to solve.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Billionaire Mugger.
programme.desc: The shooting of a billionaire computer mogul during an attempted mugging intrigues the detective - especially once he discovers the attacker was another wealthy businessman. His investigation reveals the men involved knew each other and had come into conflict a few years earlier.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A known sex offender is suspected of raping several women and murdering one in her home. His lawyer proves to be a match for Brenda, putting the team at risk of losing the case. Starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda's plans to organise her wedding are put on hold when a phone containing text messages pointing to a possible murder is found. Fritz's sister Claire, who fancies herself as a psychic, tags along and tries to help with the investigation. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo is reunited with his old flame, Jeanne Benoit, when insurgents in Sudan attack a group of volunteer doctors, including her husband. Travelling to the crime scene to conduct a joint murder-kidnapping investigation, Dinozzi and McGee offer their assistance in searching for the missing doctors. Crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly and Sean Murray, with Scottie Thompson.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Petty officer Kyle Friedgen is accused of killing his ex-girlfriend, but while his case is dismissed due to a mishandled warrant, his life and reputation are marred by suspicion that he got away with murder. Determined to clear his name in full, Friedgen volunteers to be court-martialled, on the condition that the NCIS team conducts its own investigation. Meanwhile, Bishop and Jake discuss their marital problems. Naval crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham, with Jamie Bamber.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Other Woman.
programme.desc: Stottlemeyer suspects a pretty blonde named Monica Waters is guilty of three murders - but Adrian is struck by her odd resemblance to his late wife Trudy and refuses to believe she could be guilty of foul play. Tony Shalhoub stars.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Marathon Man.
programme.desc: A woman is murdered while the San Francisco Marathon is taking place, and Monk suspects her married lover is to blame - even though he was one of the competitors and somehow managed to be registered at all checkpoints during the race. Tony Shalhoub stars.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda and Fritz's wedding day approaches, one is preoccupied with a murder case and the other with the search for a drug lord. Starring Kyra Sedgwick and Jon Tenney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: As Brenda and the team investigate the quadruple murder of a family, they find themselves in the middle of an FBI case that could have a connection to the victims. Meanwhile, Provenza's good mood takes a turn for the worse. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick and GW Bailey.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The two Marine brothers of a sailor battling leukaemia are killed in the line of duty, and to spare the servicemen's family further grief, the secretary of the US Navy seeks the NCIS team's help in locating a suitable bone marrow donor. Meanwhile, Bishop returns home to Oklahoma for Thanksgiving. Military crime drama, starring Emily Wickersham.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky is assaulted by a man who claims to have previously undisclosed information about his half-brother, who died decades ago. While his NCIS colleagues traces the attacker's whereabouts, Dr Mallard recalls the emotional final days he spent with his sibling. Elsewhere, as the holiday season approaches, Bishop and Jake discuss the future of their relationship. Naval crime drama, starring David McCallum.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agent Carter
programme.desc: Peggy tries to steal one of Howard's inventions from the SSR, and Dooley goes to Germany to interrogate a Nazi war criminal who reveals the truth behind a massacre during the war.(n)

programme.desc: The truth behind both shootings is revealed, as Preston presents the facts to the jurors, and as the Sheriff's Department loses one of its own, the real culprit is unveiled.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Chris attend a fat camp, where they encounter a serial killer who targets overweight children, and Stewie becomes terrified of the robot on the cover of Queen album News of the World.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Brian and Quagmire are left to rediscover their own identities when they wake up following a seemingly innocent boys' night out to find their memories have been erased and Quahog is deserted.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: For Whom the Sleigh Bell Tolls.

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The Smiths are forced to move into a hotel following an incident in which Roger released lethal gas into their home. However, Francine soon becomes bored with her new surroundings and decides to assume the identity of a businesswoman.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter hits his head and develops total amnesia, leaving Lois facing the task of reacquainting him with his friends and family - not to mention such skills as driving and having sex.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian is hired by a magazine and decides to follow Meg for research, but discovers she has a secret boyfriend who has broken out of jail and is hiding in the Griffins' house. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane, Alex Borstein and Mila Kunis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is delighted when Roger offers to help him open a restaurant, but their differences of opinion wreak havoc. Elsewhere, Steve sees an opportunity for romance when the new girl at school invites him over while her parents are out of town.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: A marriage counsellor hypnotises Francine and unwittingly revives her long-held dreams of becoming a comedienne. Meanwhile, Steve brings home a potential love interest for Klaus.(n)

programme.sub-title: Be Careful What You Fish For.
programme.desc: Peter promises a favour to a helpful dolphin when he and his friends try to salvage a sunken car. However, the sea creature overstays his welcome in Quahog, prompting Peter to track down his estranged wife. With the guest voice of Ricky Gervais.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Mort enlists the help of Peter and Quagmire as he battles overwhelming financial troubles, but things take a turn for the worse when they decide to burn down his pharmacy for the insurance money.(n)

programme.title: American Dad

programme.desc: Stan is awaiting his annual jury summons, but there is trouble ahead when becomes the foreman in a trial where Roger is the defendant. Meanwhile, Jeff and Hayley move in with the Smiths, and Francine tries to get Jeff to clean up his act.(n)

programme.desc: A wealthy businessman is apparently killed in an earthquake, but Adrian is sure that he was murdered by his wife, and sets out to investigate. Unfortunately, it is not long before the trauma of an aftershock deprives him of the power of speech.(n)

This upsets Joyce because she and Vince still aren't officially married yet and this is a sore point with her. Molly secretly finds out that Vince has fallen on some hard times financially and he doesn't want to marry her until he can provide the wedding she deserves. Worse is to come when they are captured by Japanese forces, and he endures brutal treatment in a PoW camp run by an infamous war criminal. programme.desc: Roger Mooking heads to Sloughhouse to visit Passmore Ranch, a freshwater, sustainable fish farm, before he heads on the hunt for Santa Maria-style barbecue.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri makes stops in North Carolina and California as he tastes some killer collard greens and turkey chilli.(n)

programme.title: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
programme.desc: Guy Fieri enjoys the taste of the Far East. In Las Vegas, he samples a Japanese spot that prepares sushi and traditional udon, and in Denver he visits a Korean joint.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps to save Bob's struggling restaurant, Junction 46, so he can retire. Although the business was initially successful when it opened two years ago, it has declined.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owners of the Gateway Restaurant and Lodge in California, contact Charles after hearing complaints of unauthorised parties taking place inside their vacant cabins.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Fillmore and Western Railway in California, is concerned about missing supplies, and rumours of unauthorised passengers during his train's dinner theatre service.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.sub-title: Minnesota State Fair: Curds, Corn and Cracklins.
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern hits the Minnesota State Fair where some of the country's most kitschy and bizarre food is a main attraction.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine helps Marie's at Ummat Cafe, which is situated next to Atlanta's oldest mosque, leading potential customers to falsely believe it is strictly for Muslims.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of Beets Cafe, Austin, Texas, asks the team for help when she fears that her employees are selling the secret recipes to her raw food menu.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After Paul, owner of Nacho Daddy in Las Vegas, notices a problem with the expensive scorpions used in his restaurant's `scorpion shot', he contacts Charles to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten reveals the secrets of cooking with wine, with expert help from her friend Martine Warner.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten gets a tagine cooking lesson from teacher and chef Gail Arnold.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten creates the perfect French dinner party with a slow cooked lamb recipe, and tips on how to create the ideal setting.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa - Back to Basics
programme.desc: Ina Garten shares her favourite chocolate recipes and chocolatier Brigitte Browney reveals how to get professional results at home.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef talks through the essentials of throwing a great dinner party, and shows how cooking for a crowd can be a fun and gratifying task.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: The chef prepares a healthy, delicious meal that can be served either hot or cold for a team of fire-fighters with large appetites.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Can Ezra and Julie come to the rescue of a farm mum with ten kids who won't eat vegetables, by hiding the vegetables in amongst other food types.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: It's dinner for two with Ree and her husband, Ladd. They whip up fried shrimp with cocktail sauce, spicy curly fries, grilled corn casserole and Mexican chocolate sundaes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond demonstrates how to prepare her own take on comforting home cooking.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers create Monopoly inspired cakes for the centrepiece for a party celebrating the classic board game.(n)

programme.title: Beach Bites With Katie Lee
programme.desc: This time, Katie Lee is exploring the beaches of Mexico, St Barts and other coastal canteens.(n)

programme.title: Beach Bites With Katie Lee
programme.desc: Katie Lee finds authentic beach cuisine that stays true to its local origins, as she hits up a Georgia beach barbecue for pulled pork and samples ceviche in St Barts.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using homegrown brassicas - a vegetable group that includes cauliflower, broccoli, curly kale and kohlrabi. The chef is surprised to discover how many of these plants can be eaten raw, but it does not stop him using them to prepare curried fritters and a hearty cannelloni.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef explains the value of pickling and preserving home-grown produce and explains why knowledge of these processes has been of vital importance throughout history. He goes on to demonstrate the procedure by pickling courgettes with mint and chilli, as well as aubergines with garlic and oregano.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver seeks the authentic tastes of Spain in Andalucia. He makes paella for the whole town of Ronda, birthplace of modern bullfighting, and is taught how to cut serrano ham by an award-winning father and son team. As he joins in the local festivities, including carrying a giant statue of the Virgin Mary from church to church, he takes time to cook tomato salad with chorizo, pork chops with Spanish beans, and quail's egg with black pudding.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing four vibrant recipes to celebrate the colours of summer.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's daughter Paige and her friend Stanton request Chinese food for their sleepover dinner, so Ree prepares an Asian-inspired feast.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four master bakers compete to have their cake at the centre of a party celebrating the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the Swedish capital, where he tries reindeer heart at an old indoor market and catches a boat to pick wild mushrooms and blueberries on one of the city's surrounding islands. He also tries fermented herring, heads to the royal palace to check the guards' menu, and prepares gravadlax, blueberry buns, creamy mushrooms, pike perch and roasted beetroot salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver prepares simple recipes using tomatoes and demonstrates how even the tiniest balcony or backyard can be used to grow fruit and vegetables. He also creates an oven-baked sausage ragu and seasonal salad, before mixing up a pale pink tomato and vodka consomme.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver creates a selection of dishes with the bumper crop of courgettes he has grown in his garden, including a salad and a recipe that involves deep-frying and stuffing the edible flowers. He also shows how the vegetable can be served as an accompaniment to grilled mackerel.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits the Jack Mountain Bushcraft School in Masardis, Maine where owner and wilderness guide, Tim Smith, shows him how to create a rustic outdoor kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits two places in New England that host delicious fireplace feasts.(n)

programme.title: Bakers vs. Fakers
programme.desc: Pro and amateur bakers face off during a fruit tart battle, combining a variety of mustards with their sweet treats.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie is called in to help Joy, owner of Osaka's Japanese Cuisine, the first sushi restaurant in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After noticing over $4,000 missing from her office safe, Keeli, owner of Fuzion in Huntington Beach, California, believes one of her managers is responsible.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A former client wants to invest in a failing California restaurant, but the Mystery Diners discover the current owner is not being honest about all of his problems.(n)

programme.desc: Granville places an ad in a lonely hearts magazine and finally meets the girl of his dreams. After stretching the truth about being a young executive with a flash sports car, his romance ends before it even begins. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Bridget & Eamon
programme.desc: Comedy spin-off from Republic of Telly following the lives of an unhappily married couple and their indeterminate number of children, character already well-known to the viewing public from their appearances on Republic of Telly. Eamon always spends the money from the trocaire box, so parish priest Fr Gabriel is keeping an eye on him this year, while Bridget hosts a Tupperware party that goes disastrously wrong when illegal condoms are delivered instead. Jennifer Zamparelli and Bernard O'Shea star.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Bank Holiday Monday sees the Essex contingent arrive for a sunny day at the beach in Barry. Gavin has a heart-to-heart with his dad, which gives him much to think about, while a dark cloud looms on the horizon when Dave arrives to find Nessa and Smithy enjoying all the fun of the fair. Mathew Horne, Joanna Page, James Corden and Ruth Jones star.(n)

programme.desc: Cheeky Londoner Lee Nelson plays host for a `well good' session of stand-up from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by Canadian funnyman Stewart Francis and observational comic Paul Chowdhry.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark acts as roadie for Jeremy and Super Hans when they find a band manager and play at a Christian rock festival, where he learns how to have sex properly for the first time in his life. Award-winning comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

His dedication pays off when investigating a tip-off about some drugs dealers. They put him on the trail of the manufacturers of a dangerous new hallucinogen that causes users to become both violent and fearless. But, just as he seems to be making progress, he finds himself prime suspect for a murder he did not commit..(n)

programme.title: Demolition
programme.desc: Davis Mitchell (Jake Gyllenhaal) has a comfortable life as a Wall Street investment banker, but it's brought to an abrupt halt when his wife is killed in a car accident. As he struggles to move on from this tragedy, he reflects on the stagnant marriage he had with his late spouse. He also becomes obsessed with dismantling the machines surrounding him as a coping mechanism, and begins a relationship with a customer-service representative for a vending-machine company (Naomi Watts) after sending them multiple complaint letters. Director Jean-Marc Vallée directed this black dramedy, which made its world premiere at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: This spirited romp is a throwback to classic screwball comedies of the 1930s and '40s. Eva Longoria Parker is a scream as a bride who suffers a fatal accident during her wedding, and later returns as a ghost to keep her husband from taking a new lover. Paul Rudd is outstanding as her husband; Lake Bell is a treat as the new woman in his life, a caterer who doubles as a psychic; and Lindsay Sloane is impressive as his kooky sister, Chloe. Written and directed by Jeff Lowell(n)

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: This spirited romp is a throwback to classic screwball comedies of the 1930s and '40s. Paul Rudd is outstanding as her husband; Lake Bell is a treat as the new woman in his life, a caterer who doubles as a psychic; and Lindsay Sloane is impressive as his kooky sister, Chloe. Written and directed by Jeff Lowell(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2002 musical (itself an adaptation of John Waters' 1988 original movie) stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music-and-dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show? Also starring John Travolta (in drag and a fat-suit) as Tracy's mum, Christopher Walken, as her dad, and Amanda Bynes, James Marsden, Brittany Snow, Zac Efron and Elijah Kelley; plus cameos from the star of the original movie, Ricki Lake, and its director, John Waters(n)

programme.title: Martin Lawrence Live: Runteldat
programme.desc: Martin Lawrence is one of America's top black comedians, spoken of in the same breath as the late Richard Pryor and Eddie Murphy when they were at the height of their stand-up powers, and he's also appeared in films including Big Momma's House and Bad Boys. But he's also suffered setbacks in his personal life, from being arrested with a loaded gun at an airport to being accused by his co-star in the TV show Martin of sexual harassment. In this outstanding film of his stand-up routine, he confronts his demons and those who demonise him, as well as veering off to his favourite subject: women, and how hard they are to live with. And 'rundletat' is short for 'run and tell that'(n)

programme.title: Blues Brothers 2000
programme.desc: After their first adventure, Elwood was given a prison sentence of 18 years. Upon release he learns that his former partner Jake has died. Determined to get the band back together, he picks up 10-year-old Buster and Mack McTeer. They travel across the country to Louisiana for a battle of the bands(n)

programme.title: Major Payne
programme.desc: A by-the-book, career marine assigned to a boys military academy comes under fire for the harsh tactics he uses to whip the cadets into shape(n)

programme.title: Tracey Ullman's Show
programme.desc: Epsiode 5. Kate Middleton's mother babysits Prince George; Maggie Smith mulls an action movie franchise; a zookeeper misses her favourite monkey; American tourists see a darker side of Britain; a vicar is late for a funeral and turns to social media for help(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: Blast From the Past
programme.desc: A naive man experiences the real world for the first time after being raised in a bomb shelter since the Cuban Missile Crisis. While stocking up on supplies for his still-underground parents, he falls for a cynical '90s gal in this charming rom com(n)

programme.title: Catch Me if You Can
programme.desc: Teenage fraudster Frank Abagnale Jr takes on various identities in order to cash fake cheques worth over $2.5m. But his outlandish scheme soon catches the eye of the FBI. Crime(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. Revisiting the "Americans in France" theme that Ivory explored in 1998's A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries, the film stars Kate Hudson as Isabel Walker. When she receives word that her pregnant poetess sister Roxy (Naomi Watts) has been left by her philandering French husband, artist Charles-Henri de Persand (Melvil Poupaud), Isabel offers her help and moral support. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

programme.title: Taking Care of Business
programme.desc: James Belushi and Charles Grodin team up for this variation on the Prince and the Pauper. Belushi plays Jimmy Dworski, a convicted car thief, serving time in a minimum security prison. But when Jimmy wins a pair of tickets to the World Series from a radio call-in show, he can't resist walking out of jail, particularly when the warden won't even let the inmates watch the series on television. Grodin plays rich workaholic Spencer Barnes, who, when his wife walks out on him right before a long-planned vacation, leaves his datebook in an airport telephone booth. Happening upon Spencer's datebook is Jimmy, who simply intends to return the datebook to Spencer for a 1,000-dollar reward. But when he finds the datebook contains his credit cards, Jimmy assumes Spencer's identity, living the good life and dating the boss's daughter, while making his way to Malibu to return the property to Spencer(n)

programme.title: Doctor Dolittle
programme.desc: Rex Harrison, although not at all like the portly man described in Hugh Lofting's charming series of children's stories, is sheer perfection as the kindly animal doctor in Leslie Bricusse's musical fantasy Doctor Dolittle. Sadly, Harrison is the only thing nearing perfection in this overstuffed and over-mounted fiasco that nearly brought down 20th Century Fox. Considered a lunatic because he can converse in 498 animal dialects, Dolittle gathers up his friends Matthew Mugg (Anthony Newley) and Emma Fairfax (Samantha Eggar) and heads off on a journey to the South Seas to find the elusive great pink snail and the giant lunar moth. Along the way, the group encounters a succession of bizarre human and animal characters -- most notably the legendary pushme-pullyou, an animal so freakish that it compels Albert Blossom (Richard Attenborough) to burst out into the exuberant song, "I've never Seen Anything Like It in My Life." Incredibly, the film was nominated for a Best Picture Oscar in 1967(n)

programme.title: The Secret of the Magic Gourd

But soon the magic gourd begins to drive the lad out of his gourd. Gigi Leung, Peisi Chen. Directed by John Chu and Frankie Chung, and written by Chu and Lam Kee To, who adapted the popular 1958 kids' book by Zhang Tianyi(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Raucous comedy starring John Cho and Kal Penn, with Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg taking the directors' chairs for this outing in addition to their regular writing duties. When the stoner duo unwisely smuggle their drugs paraphernalia on to a US bound flight from Amsterdam, US Homeland Security misinterpret their intentions and they are promptly shipped off to the infamous US Army detention camp in Cuba. And so the scene is set for a series of none-too-subtle gags as our THC-loving heroes seek to make their escape. Sophisticated it may not be, but if crude and politically incorrect humour is your thing then there are certainly plenty of laughs to be had here. And the film also seems to raise the question of who's the more paranoid: two long-term marijuana users or the US Government(n)
