He joins forces with two locals, and they embark on a quest to stop a treacherous corporation that has been illegally dumping toxic waste. Marg Helgenberger, Harry Dean Stanton, Stephen Lang(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: When their regular babysitter can't make it, two suburban parents hire her friend "Anna" (Sarah Bolger) to look after their three children while they enjoy a night out. But when Anna's behavior becomes increasingly unhinged, eldest sibling Jacob (Joshua Rush) grows suspicious and discovers that she's actually an imposter named Emelie who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child. Directed by Michael Thelin, Emelie made its world premiere at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Dragon Blade
programme.desc: In this action epic set during the Han dynasty, a Chinese commander joins forces with a Roman general to protect China's sovereignty from a power-hungry villain(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 178. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The Island of Dr. Moreau
programme.desc: Spectacular horror movie based on the classic HG Wells novel about a mad scientist and his shocking experiments in genetics. Edward Douglas (David Thewlis) is on a UN mission when his aircraft crashes in the South Pacific. Taken to a remote island which is the domain of the mysterious Dr Moreau (Marlon Brando), Douglas encounters a race of strange, sub-human creatures who intrigue him. Douglas' curiosity draws him into restricted areas, where he is confronted with the full horror of Dr Moreau's genetic experiments on animals and humans. After the Dr's most frightening experiment goes badly wrong, Douglas realises that his own life may be in jeopardy unless he can somehow maintain order - as well as his own sanity(n)

programme.title: American Psycho II: All American Girl
programme.desc: In this chilling sequel, deranged killer Patrick Bateman's murderous legacy lives on in one of his survivors (Mila Kunis). She's a coed who's competing for a job as assistant to a famous serial-killer hunter. Her strategy for landing the post: murder. William Shatner, Geraint Wyn Davies, Robin Dunne, Lindy Booth(n)

programme.title: They Live
programme.desc: A drifter discovers that aliens have invaded the Earth and have hypnotised the population into believing that they are in fact just ordinary humans(n)

programme.title: Her
programme.desc: Writer Joaquin Phoenix begins a relationship with his hyper-intelligent computer (voiced by Scarlett Johansson). Oscar-winning romance. Strong language/sex/flashing images(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: This was the third follow-up to Tim Burton's Batman (1989), the original revisionist look at the Gotham City legend, as well as the second in the Batman series directed by Joel Schumacher and the first featuring George Clooney as the Caped Crusader; it features not one but two super-villains, and a new heroine to fight crime alongside Bruce Wayne (aka Batman) and Dick Grayson (aka Robin) (Chris O'Donnell). The experiments of Dr. Victor Fries (Arnold Schwarzenegger) to preserve his late wife cryogenically have gone horribly wrong, turning him into the evil genius Mr. Freeze, who must keep his body at sub-zero temperature in order to say alive -- and he wants to put Gotham City on ice. Shy horticulturist Pamela Isley (Uma Thurman) goes a bit wild with a Venus Fly Trap-like creation she's been working on and mutates into Poison Ivy, who wants to kill all the people on Earth so plants can take over. Can Batman and Robin stop these fiends before their plans go too far? Meanwhile, Bruce and Dick's faithful butler Alfred (Michael Gough) isn't feeling well, so his niece Barbara (Alicia Silverstone) comes to pay a visit. When Barbara finds out what her uncle's employers do in their spare time, she decides she wants in on the action, and she joins the crime fighting twosome as Batgirl. Batman & Robin also features Jesse Ventura in a small role as a prison guard; it would be his last film role before becoming Governor of Minnesota in 1998(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: Accused of cheating and desperate to prove his innocence, an eighteen-year-old orphan from the slums of Mumbai reflects back on his tumultuous life while competing to win 20 million rupees on India's Who Wants to Be a Millionaire in Danny Boyle's inspirational drama. Jamal Malik (Dev Patel) may not have a penny to his name, but that could all change in a matter of hours. He's one question away from taking the top prize on India's most popular television game show, but as with everything else in Jamal's life, it isn't going to be easy. Arrested by police under suspicion of cheating, Jamal is interrogated by the authorities. The police simply can't believe that a common "slumdog" could possibly possess the knowledge to get this far in the game, and in order to convince them of how he gained such knowledge, Jamal begins reflecting back on his childhood. As young boys, Jamal and his older brother, Salim, lived in squalor, and lost their mother in a mob attack on Muslims. Subsequently forced to rely on their own wits to survive, the desperate siblings fell back on petty crime, eventually befriending adorable yet feisty young Latika as they sought out food and shelter on the unforgiving streets of Mumbai. Though life on the streets was never easy, Jamal's experiences ultimately instilled in him the knowledge he needed to answer the tough questions posed to him on Who Wants to Be a Millionaire. And though Jamal makes a convincing case for himself, one question still remains: why would a young man with no apparent desire for wealth or fame be so determined to win big on a national game show? Of course, it won't be long until everyone finds out the answer to this burning question, because as Jamal sits down to find out whether he will be rich beyond his wildest dreams, 60 million viewers remain transfixed to their televisions eager to see if he'll correctly answer the final question(n)

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: This fascinating thriller follows the rise and fall of Ronald and Reginald Kray, identical twin gangsters who built a criminal empire in London during the 1950s and '60s using gruesome, unhinged tactics and savvy business acumen(n)

programme.title: Thirteen
programme.desc: Prolific production designer and art director Catherine Hardwicke makes her directorial debut with the coming-of-age drama Thirteen. Los Angeles teenager and overachiever Tracy (Evan Rachel Wood) is an excellent student in her seventh grade class and gets along well with her mother, Melanie (Holly Hunter). She fears that she's not cool enough to be friends with Evie (Nikki Reed), the most popular girl in school. Fueled with genuine adolescent energy, Tracy follows Evie's lead into the harsh realities of sex, drugs, and hard-edged adventure. Consumed with temptations and conflicting desires, Tracy loses her good-girl identity, greatly affecting her relationship with her mom. Partly autobiographical, Thirteen was co-written by Hardwicke and actual 13-year-old Reed, who are close family friends. Originally intending to write a teen comedy, they ended up creating a hard-hitting drama exposing the contemporary teenage experience. Thirteen was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the 2003 Sundance Film Festival, with Catherine Hardwicke taking home the Director's Award(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: They've kept television viewers laughing for nearly 20 years, and now the most popular animated family on the small screen makes the leap into theaters as Homer, Marge, Lisa, Bart, ad Maggie embark on their first-ever feature-length adventure. Directed by David Silverman and written by a whole host of Simpsons veterans including Matt Groening and James L. Brooks, The Simpsons Movie also features special guest appearances by Albert Brooks among others(n)

programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc: Combining Hi-8 video with black-and-white 16 mm film, this film presents a raw look at what can happen when college students forego common sense and enter the world of voodoo and witchcraft. Presented as a straightforward documentary, the film opens with a title card explaining that in 1994, three students went into the Maryland back woods to do a film project on the Blair Witch incidents. These kids were never seen again, and the film you are about to see is from their recovered equipment, found in the woods a year later. The entire movie documents their adventures leading up to their final minutes. The Blair Witch incident, as we initially learn from the local town elders, is an old legend about a group of witches who tortured and killed several children many years ago. Everyone in town knows the story and they're all sketchy on the details. Out in the woods and away from their parked car (and civilization), what starts as a school exercise turns into a nightmare when the three kids lose their map. Forced to spend extra days finding their way out, the kids then start to hear horrific sounds outside their tents in the pitch-black middle of night. They also find strange artifacts from (what can only be) the Blair Witch, still living in the woods. Frightened, they desperately try to find their way out of the woods, with no luck. Slowly these students start to unravel, knowing they have no way of getting out, no food, and it's getting cold. Each night they are confronted with shrieking and sounds so haunting that they are convinced someone is following them, and they quickly begin to fear for their lives. The film premiered in the midnight movie section at the 1999 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Satan's hopeless son is banished to earth when he disappoints his father one time too many, but finds New York City just as confusing as hell(n)

programme.title: Crooklyn
programme.desc: Portrait of a close-knit black family living in 1970s Brooklyn, as seen through the eyes of the youngest daughter. This comedy-drama follows them as they deal with money woes, eccentric neighbors and the sons' troublemaking(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: A genetic mutation causes mild-mannered Bruce Banner to turn into the green and muscular Incredible Hulk when he gets angry. While he searches for a cure, the military attempt to create their own genetically modified equivalent using one of their soldiers(n)

programme.title: Vice News Tonight
programme.desc: Episode 179. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Director Michael Bay returns with his second instalment of the sci-fi action romp that pits humans against some big, bad (very bad) alien robots, the Decepticons. In this sequel, which manages to be even louder and more prone to explosions than the initial outing, Sam Witwicky and his girlfriend Mikaela Banes are once more at the centre of the action. Witwicky is being hunted down by the Decepticons, who recognise that he is their main impediment to their gaining control of an awesome source of energy. As the Decepticons' plan would result in the destruction of the Sun, mankind's fate rests on the shoulders (and in the ingenuity) of our oddly named hero..(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonizing that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.title: Hemingway & Gellhorn
programme.desc: Clive Owen and Nicole Kidman star as literary legend Ernest Hemingway and war correspondent Martha Gellhorn in this true-life romantic tale spanning countries and war zones. With David Strathairn, Molly Parker and Parker Posey(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Huntsman: Winter's War'
programme.desc: A look at "The Huntsman: Winter's War," a 2016 prequel to "Snow White and the Huntsman" that follows the Huntsman and his secret lover Sara as they attempt to stop Freya the Ice Queen and her evil sister from conquering the forest. The film stars Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron and Emily Blunt, and is directed by Cedric Nicolas-Troyan(n)

programme.title: Grumpier Old Men
programme.desc: 1995. Odd couple Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau are reunited for this curmudgeonly comedy sequel. Two Italian women plan to turn the old guys' bait shop into a restaurant. Dir: Lorant Deutch(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Sick of being bullied by her overpowering Greek family, dowdy Toula signs up for college. Despite every warning, Toula falls for a non-Greek guy, but it's not easy getting her clan to accept him(n)

programme.title: Tin Cup
programme.desc: Comedy starring Kevin Costner as a washed up golf pro who decides to try and qualify for the US Open in order to win the heart of Rene Russo(n)

programme.title: Fast Times at Ridgemont High
programme.desc: Director Amy Heckerling's hilarious teen movie follows brother and sister Brad and Stacy through a world of dead-end jobs, uninspiring classes, borrowed cars and sexual anxiety. Sean Penn is unforgettable as a stoned surfer(n)

programme.title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
programme.desc: Batman and Superman clash over differing philosophies about what kind of heroism is needed to protect the world in this soaring comic-book extravaganza. However, the duo are soon forced to confront an even greater threat created by Lex Luthor(n)

programme.desc: Pizza Boy. A pizza delivery boy gets caught up in a couple's twisted games(n)

programme.sub-title: Al Gore; Ralph Reed; Kristen Soltis Anderson; Joshua Green; Michael Weiss
programme.desc: Al Gore; Ralph Reed; Kristen Soltis Anderson; Joshua Green; Michael Weiss. Former vice president Al Gore and political activist Ralph Reed are the interview guests. The panelists are political consultant Kristen Soltis Anderson, and journalists Joshua Green and Michael Weiss(n)

programme.title: Mystic River
programme.desc: Childhood friends Jimmy, Sean and Dave are reunited by a tragedy involving one of their children. As homicide detective Sean investigates, Jimmy enlists his relatives to launch their own inquiry. Later, suspicions fall on Jimmy and Sean's old friend Dave, who harbors some disturbing secrets(n)

programme.title: Cop Land
programme.desc: Sherrif Freddy Heflin faces a terrible dilemma when he is forced to choose between his dream of joining the New York City police force (he's partially deaf and ineligible) or forcing the NYPD cops to stop brutalizing and corrupting his small town. Sylvester Stallone heads a high-powered cast(n)

programme.title: Monday
programme.desc: A young drug dealer struggles with the moral implications of his work(n)

programme.title: Defending Your Life
programme.desc: Whimsical afterlife fantasy in which a middle-aged man, killed in a car crash, is asked to justify his life and explain the scantiness of his few acts of bravery and selflessness. Judgement City is a limbo where lives are assessed by an independent tribunal who decide whether the recently deceased are eligible for Heaven. While awaiting the decision that may alter the course of his death, he falls in love with a fellow defendant(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Exuberant musical based on the hit stage show featuring the music of ABBA. 20-year-old Sophie lives on an idyllic Greek island with her free-spirited mother Donna. When Sophie gets engaged to her boyfriend, she decides that she wants her father at her wedding - but unfortunately, she does not know who her father is. She takes matters into her own hands and invites the three possible candidates to the wedding, without the knowledge of her mother. Will Donna reveal who Sophie's real dad is? And is she as reluctant to see her former lovers as she claims?(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: The spy spoof series gets the big screen treatment with this action comedy. Agents 86, 99, and 23 lead Control against the evil entity KAOS(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his friend decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various hit movies(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: Director Roger Michell follows up the hit romantic comedy Notting Hill (1999) with this thought-provoking thriller. Ben Affleck and Samuel L. Jackson star, respectively, as Gavin Banek and Doyle Gibson, two New York men whose lives become accidentally intertwined in a Good Friday fender bender on the FDR Drive. Late for a crucial appointment, hotshot lawyer Gavin tosses Doyle a blank check and leaves the scene, while Doyle, whose car is inoperable, is late for a court-appointed custody hearing. A recovering alcoholic, Doyle's tardiness doesn't sit well with the judge, who - sick of waiting for Gipson - grants custody to Doyle's ex-wife in Doyle's absence. The situation worsens when it becomes evident that Doyle has an equally important file belonging to Gavin, which proves that an elderly man gave Banek's firm power-of-attorney over his foundation. So begins an escalating war of words and deeds between the two men. Soon, egged on by an associate (Toni Collette), Gavin hires a "fixer" (Dylan Baker) to destroy Doyle's credit, forcing Doyle to fire back with some cunning moves of his own. Changing Lanes co-stars William Hurt, Sydney Pollack, and Toni Collette(n)

programme.title: Criminal Activities
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller, four friends get in over their heads when they become indebted to a dangerous crime boss. Now, they must kidnap a beloved member of a rival kingpin's family in order to erase their debt, and do so without getting caught or killed in the process(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Three female friends inadvertently bring the devil to their sleepy New England town. He proceeds to seduce each of them, and the trio must work together again to stop him from his plans for total domination(n)

programme.desc: Hella Open. Issa's sexual frustration prompts her to reassess her dating outlook; Molly meets a potential beau on a girls' night out; Lawrence's new work friends test his commitment(n)

programme.desc: Sequel in which Deloris reunites with her sisters to teach music at an inner-city school and save it from being shut down(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

When Rick hears a song written by Peter, the ball starts rolling for a onslaught of intrigue, ill will and murder predicated on the fact that the missing Peter will fall heir to millions should he ever make a return appearance. Madrid won their 12th European Cup with victory over Juventus in Cardiff in June, while United overcame Ajax in Stockholm to win the Europa League - formerly known as the UEFA Cup - for the first time. With analysis from Glenn Hoddle and Lee Dixon, and commentary by Clive Tyldesley.(n)

programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the airport. Heavy fog throws Heathrow into turmoil and new terminal manager Callum is faced with hundreds of angry and stranded passengers stuck overnight at the airport, while visibility has dropped to less than 100m on the airfield and safety officer Chris is forced to marshal planes. Manager Nilam reveals the secrets of one of Heathrow's most exclusive first-class lounges and dispatcher James and his team hunt around the terminal for late passengers for a flight to Pakistan.(n)

programme.desc: The comedian begins another tour of Zambia, Namibia and South Africa helping to hand-rear orphaned animals and prepare them for release back into their natural habitats. His first stop is the Moholoholo Wildlife Rehabilitation Centre, where he meets an eight-month-old rhino which lost its mother when she was killed by poachers. Next, he teaches a young aardvark how to hunt for termites, before providing some much-needed company for a lion cub which was raised as a pet until she got too big to handle.(n)

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: Flora decides to throw an anniversary dinner party for her late lamented greengrocer husband and takes over the catering arrangements, resulting in a very unusual gourmet offering.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Darling Buds of May - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Taxman Charley decides to escape from the office and go strawberry-picking with Mariette and the rest of the Larkin family - a move that leaves his career hanging in the balance. Light-hearted drama based on the novels by HE Bates, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris, Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: First of a two-part storyline. Jenny's life starts to spiral out of control and begins to affect her work, leaving Dennis and Liz facing difficult decisions. New doctor Helen Trent arrives in Aidensfield with her wealthy husband Matt, hoping to make a fresh start, but finds it hard to adjust to the slow pace of life in the country. Sophie Ward joins the regular cast, including Sarah Tansey, Duncan Bell and Aislin McGuckin.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A train crash claims the life of an infant making Jill more determined than ever to support Carnegie's plans for a premature baby unit at the hospital. Meanwhile, local farmer Sam Benson (guest star Jack Deam) causes concern with his erratic behaviour, and Stella's rapist requires life-saving surgery after being attacked by the father of another victim.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: When the Green Woods Laugh - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ma can hardly contain her enthusiasm now that Mariette and Charley have announced their intention to marry. Unfortunately, Pop puts all his finances into bidding for a stately home, casting a shadow over her extravagant plans for the wedding. Rural drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: You're Only Young Twice
programme.desc: When Cissie advertises to swap crochet patterns, she receives an overwhelming response. Comedy set in a residential home, starring Peggy Mount and Pat Coombs.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack feel guilty about an accident in the bus, so they volunteer to care for the Inspector's pets while he is on holiday. Vintage comedy, starring Reg Varney.(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Rigsby wines and dines Miss Jones in a suit surreptitiously `borrowed' from stroppy wrestler Spooner - who turns up halfway through the main course intent on exacting revenge. Vintage comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective is faced with a difficult case when he investigates the discovery of a body in a well, and he also has to contend with a new boss, Chief Superintendent Moody, who is dubious as to Lewis' motivation for coming out of retirement. As investigations into the human remains in the well proceed, an avant-garde artist's body is also discovered and at first glance it looks like a tragic drugs overdose, but Hathaway and Lewis quickly recognise the tell tale signs of murder.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: For two years, Stephanie Blake has been tormented by a cyberstalker whose e-mails have grown more intimidating over time, but without an actual physical threat against her, there is little the team can do to help. Then, the case turns into a murder investigation, and one of the officers becomes a key witness for the prosecution, but the question arises as to how far he will go to bring the right man to justice. Guest starring Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral).(n)

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.sub-title: Sherlock Holmes: The Sign of Four.
programme.desc: Holmes is presented with a mystery surrounding a woman's unknown benefactor - and uncovers a story of hidden treasure, implacable vengeance and sudden death. Feature-length drama, starring Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke, John Thaw and Jenny Seagrove.(n)

programme.title: Football's Greatest: Johan Cruyff
programme.desc: A profile of the former football player and manager, who played and managed Ajax and Barcelona, and represented the Netherlands on 48 occasions, scoring 33 goals.(n)

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: A man confesses to murder, thinking he has killed his boss - but the sleuthing medical examiner believes he is innocent and tries to get him off the hook. Drama, starring Jack Klugman and Robert Ito.(n)

Action adventure sequel, starring Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Julia Nickson-Soul, Steven Berkoff, George Kee Cheung, Andy Wood and Martin Kove.(n)

programme.title: Minder

programme.title: Snooker v Darts
programme.desc: Short film.(n)

programme.title: British Superbike Championship Highlights
programme.desc: James Haydon presents action from both races at Thruxton in Hampshire, where the seventh round of the season took place. With commentary by Jack Burnicle and James Whitham.(n)

programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: A reprogrammed killing machine is sent back in time to the 20th century to protect John Connor, a teenage boy whose destiny is to save the human race. After breaking John's mother out of a mental institution, the pair set out to avert a future nuclear war - pursued by an advanced prototype terminator with shape-changing powers. Sci-fi action adventure sequel, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Linda Hamilton, Edward Furlong and Robert Patrick.(n)

programme.title: Island at War
programme.desc: James confesses to the La Salles that he was responsible for Eugene's death and Sheldon discovers Zelda's hiding place in Cassie's shop, and urges her to flee the island. Philip is determined to get back to England and hatches an escape plan with the help of Wilf and James, but the day ends in disaster when the three men are arrested and sent to a prison in France.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A policewoman is murdered, and when a blood-soaked shoe is found in a suspect's wardrobe, it seems to be an open-and-shut case - but Kavanagh is not convinced the right man is in the dock. John Thaw stars.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.sub-title: If You Were the Only Girl in the World.
programme.desc: Hazel scandalises Lady Prudence by staying out all night with an airman she met at the tea party.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick and Kate receive plenty of advice from the locals when their marriage runs into trouble and Greengrass becomes the main suspect for lead theft.(n)

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: Drama series set during the dark days of the Second World War, starring John Thaw as Augustin Renard, a priest whose return from the Spanish Civil War coincides with a victorious German Army's invasion of his native France. With Cheryl Campbell, Jimmy Yuill and Alfred Lynch.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Julia is assigned a compensation case brought by a man who has sustained spinal and brain damage in an accident at work, and tries to persuade Kavanagh to lead her. Unfortunately, he already has his hands full with a tricky compensation case and son Matt's attempts to get the better of him. John Thaw stars, with Ned Sherrin, Frances Tomelty and TP McKenna.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Emily finds out she is pregnant, but the joy is tempered by ill-feeling from the Jacobs family over the death of their father, who was run over by a tractor. Meanwhile, Kate enjoys peculiar cravings. Sixties-based drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Rose receives tragic news about Gregory Wilmott, while Hazel has to deal with Jack's death and husband James's return from the front.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Beautiful Russian aristocrat Countess Vera Rossakoff, the chief suspect in a series of jewel thefts, seemingly captivates Poirot with her charm and intellect, meaning Hastings and Miss Lemon have to do most of the actual detective work and ensure she is brought to justice. Drama, guest starring Kika Markham.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Spanish Chest.
programme.desc: A lavish dinner party proves to be a prelude to murder and intrigue - but fortunately Poirot is among the guests, and soon realises the key to the mystery lies in a duel fought 10 years previously. Drama, starring David Suchet, Caroline Langrishe and John McEnery.(n)

programme.title: Cold Feet
programme.desc: David realises he may have his work cut out proving his innocence when even his wife Robyn turns against him, while Pete receives another blow when he arrives at work to see Harry. Jen is taken to task by her sister Sheila over the care of their elderly mother and Karen steps her relationship with Eddie up a notch, but a visit from a desperate David threatens her plans, and Adam faces problems when his wife becomes increasingly distant. Comedy drama, starring John Thomson, James Nesbitt, Fay Ripley, Hermione Norris and Robert Bathurst.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Stanhope and her team, including new recruit DC Hicham Cherradi, travel to a remote country house when the woman looking after it is killed. No sooner have they arrived, than a second body is discovered. Vera discovers the two victims met the night before their deaths, and goes in search of a connection between them. Forensics evidence reveals that one was definitely present when the other died - but when no murder weapon or motive can be found, Vera begins to suspect a third party was involved.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters
programme.desc: Going against the wishes of her family, married mother-of-one Steph makes a life-changing decision to become an Ann Summers demonstrator and run parties selling exotic lingerie. She enlists the help of her new friend Nita and persuades well-to-do acquaintance Pauline to host an evening, but fears it might not really be the right crowd to sell to. Drama set in Sheffield in 1982, starring Sophie Rundle, Penelope Wilton, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: Preston and Shaw investigate a case of arson at a home shared by security guard Peter and recruitment consultant Lizzie. The testy relationship between Peter and his brother David, the owner of the house, provides the officers with a suspect, but the revelation that the two cohabitors may be in a secret relationship opens up new lines of enquiry. Drama, starring Ben Hull and Jane Antrobus.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Harry is thrown when Nancy suddenly announces they should keep their relationship professional, at least until the Selfridge Estate is finished. A grieving Mr Grove is keen to carry on as normal, but continues to shun Miss Mardle, while Grace and Gordon have an embarrassing encounter with Mr Crabb. Victor and Elsa come up with a new idea for Colleano's, Violette catches the eye of a visiting French count, and a huge `Britain at Play' promotion is launched in the store to keep the shareholders happy.(n)

programme.title: Jekyll and Hyde
programme.desc: Robert frantically searches for Lily, while Captain Dance is restored when his men are able to harness the power of the Incubus, and he prepares to put his final plan into action. He launches an all-out attack on MIO headquarters to steal the jar containing Lord Trash's heart and restore the nightmarish creature to the land of the living. Robert is devastated to learn that one of his closest friends has been lying to him all along, but fresh hope emerges when he discovers there is a way to destroy the heart once and for all. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A brother and sister stand accused of murdering their father and stepmother, and pleading for them proves to be the most complex assignment of Kavanagh's entire career. The task is made doubly difficult by the man's insistence on defending himself and a tragedy within his own family - and Julia's decision to leave chambers does not help either. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Anna Chancellor and Art Malik.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick investigates graffiti at a battery egg farm, and discovers there is more to the case than meets the eye. Meanwhile, Greengrass attracts suspicion by selling free-range eggs. Police drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Edward returns home, but his experiences in the trenches have led to shell shock and he collapses during the New Year celebrations, while Hazel is saddened to learn that James will be delayed.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby.
programme.desc: The Belgian detective looks forward to a quiet Christmas, but is disturbed by the Foreign Office when an Egyptian prince loses a famous ruby - after making the mistake of lending it to a mysterious woman. Guest starring Stephanie Cole, Nigel Le Vaillant and Tariq Alibai.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: The third and final series of Chris Chibnall's crime drama set in a Dorset seaside town reaches a conclusion after a multitude of twist and turns, countless red herrings and numerous suspects with shaky alibis. In the last-ever episode the truth is finally revealed as detectives Alec Hardy and Ellie Miller finally untangle the web of deceit surrounding the rape of Trish Winterman. Starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman, with Julie Hesmondhalgh, Charlie Higson, Jodie Whittaker and Lenny Henry. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A fisherman's body is found tangled up in a North Sea trawler's net. Vera and her team investigate with the help of the local harbourmaster, and find the dead man's sons pointing the finger at the owner of a fish market, with whom they have a long-running feud. Retracing the dead man's steps, Vera discovers when he drowned and tracks down a waitress who may have been one of the last people to see him alive. However, the case becomes more complicated when a witness runs away and a boat belonging to the dead man's sister-in-law goes up in flames.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated horse gives birth prematurely, and the foal is so weak Dr Thurston takes it home to bottle feed.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The animal protection officers have cause to investigate a breeder.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 42-year-old Patricia Viola, who vanished from her New Jersey home in February 2001, shortly after a routine telephone conversation with her mother. A bone fragment was found locally just over a year later, but it would be a another decade until DNA advancements allowed its identity to be positively confirmed after comparisons were made with samples provided by Viola's two children.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: How University of Virginia lacrosse player George Huguely's drinking binge leds to a deadly encounter with his ex-girlfriend.(n)

programme.title: Corrupt Crimes
programme.desc: Crimes by the sorts of people seldom suspected, such as those with respectable jobs. Their often shocking white collar misdeeds prove a book should never be judged by its cover.(n)

programme.title: Judge Jeanine Pirro

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes house-hunters Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland to Orlando to find a family holiday home. With property prices in Florida costing half what they were five years earlier, can Jonnie help them to pick a bargain in the sun?.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Borgue Hotel in Dumfries and Galloway, which owners Vince and Shirley Barrett run with military precision. On arrival, guests Adam and Naomi are not impressed with the decor, while Ken and Elaine do not like the orange towels. Later, over dinner, the hosts reveal who wears the trousers in their relationship, before Ken's jokes go down like a lead balloon.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Allscott Mill B&B in Telford, Shropshire, on their second night, where hosts Ken and Elaine Purchase welcome their guests. On arrival, Shirely and Vince find fault with the lack of headroom in their lodgings, while Adam and Naomi are bemused by the absence of a toilet brush in their bathroom.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Park House in Llandrindod Wells, Powys, where owners Ian and Joan Barr hope their colourful B&B will impress their guests. Adam and Naomi are wowed by the vibrant decor, but Ken and Elaine take issue with a dirty toilet brush.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Naomi and Adam Black welcome the contestants to East Thorne yurt retreat in Bude, Cornwall. They are pleased to discover it is Vince and Shirley's dream location, but Ken and Elaine don't share the same opinion. Later, the guests take part in an archery competition, and in the morning, are unimpressed with the DIY breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The rival owners meet for the final time on the last day of the competition to find out what they've been paid and settle some scores. Hosting skills, breakfasts, facilities and two toilet brush gripes are aired before the cash is counted and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton tries to help model agency boss Susan Mitchell and her friend Sara Minton find their dream holiday home in Gran Canaria.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The expert archaeologists search a stretch of the River Tees for Roman artefacts thought to have come from one of the most impressive forts in northern Britain. They find buildings and roads that confirm its importance as a major strategic crossing close to the Scottish border and Hadrian's Wall, but are surprised to discover it was also the location of three Roman bridges - and perhaps another from prehistoric times. Tony Robinson presents.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Norman Cross, Cambridgeshire: Death and Dominoes - The First PoW Camp.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the archaeologists excavate the site of the world's first purpose-built PoW camp, which was constructed to incarcerate 7,000 of Napoleon's troops in 1797 at Norman Cross in Cambridgeshire. The team is particularly interested in locating the cemetery where more than 2,000 inmates were buried after dying from diseases contracted in the camp - and their search leads them to discover how degraded prisoners' lives could be.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Professional dog-walker Sandy asks Scott Miller to give her a first-aid lesson in case anything happens to her charges, while S Club 7 star Hannah Spearritt also visits the clinic.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a man whose simple plan of converting a shipping container into a garden office has proved rather more difficult than expected, and visits a canal boat that has been cleverly redesigned as the ultimate bachelor pad. He's also finally ready to unveil his own small-space project as he completes his mission to transform a caravan into a holiday home.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The team tackles a dining room using a fusion theme called Rustic Bohemian, Robin Johnson tries block printing and low-cost lamp making, and Ant Anstead blows glass bottles.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In the Lakes, farmer Pip hatches a plan to prevent the problem of lost sheep, and in the Dales, cameras follow the Dent Brewery boys as they make and distribute their craft ales.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Tracks with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The historian explores the UK's network of ancient trackways and roads, which have been walked by pilgrims, hunters and invaders over the course of the past 5,000 years, each one shrouded in myth, mystery and legend. In the first episode, Tony delves into the stories, songs and sacred places along the Icknield Way in Norfolk and Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: The team tackles a dining room using a fusion theme called Rustic Bohemian, Robin Johnson tries block printing and low-cost lamp making, and Ant Anstead blows glass bottles.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In the Lakes, farmer Pip hatches a plan to prevent the problem of lost sheep, and in the Dales, cameras follow the Dent Brewery boys as they make and distribute their craft ales.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Tracks with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: The historian explores the UK's network of ancient trackways and roads, which have been walked by pilgrims, hunters and invaders over the course of the past 5,000 years, each one shrouded in myth, mystery and legend. In the first episode, Tony delves into the stories, songs and sacred places along the Icknield Way in Norfolk and Cambridgeshire.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Guests Rhod Gilbert, Sarah Millican, Gregg Wallace and Kate Silverton join host Jimmy Carr for an extended edition of the irreverent panel show in which teams captained by Jon Richardson and Sean Lock answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton tries to help model agency boss Susan Mitchell and her friend Sara Minton find their dream holiday home in Gran Canaria.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Worcestershire, where friends Geri Atterbury and Lorraine Rigby invite guests to stay at Greenways of Malvern. On arrival, couple Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker are not impressed by the wild wallpaper, and the lack of an en-suite dismays mother-and-son duo Sarah and Luke Allaway.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Royal Forester at Bewdley in Worcestershire for their second stay, with proprietors Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker hoping to impress their guests with a trip to a local safari park. Sarah and Luke are impressed with their colourful room, but Sanjeev and Elinor have a `hairy' experience.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: From Ferry Lodge in Holyhead, Anglesey, where mother-and-son duo Sarah and Luke Allaway hope to impress the other contestants. However, things do not get off to a good start when Geri and Lorraine are overwhelmed by the number of laminated signs, Sean and Maxine begrudge paying 50p for toiletries and Sanjeev and Elinor are left unimpressed by the cleanliness of the establishment.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Partners Sanjeev Bhagotra and Elinor Roberts welcome their guests to Court Colman Manor, Bridgend, Glamorgan. Sean McGahern and Maxine Parker are pleased with the size of their room on arrival, but Sarah Allaway discovers a collection of cobwebs in hers. During the afternoon, the groups take a lesson in fire-making, and the next morning a traditional Welsh breakfast is not to everyone's taste - with the hosts wondering whether tactical voting has played a part come feedback time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet one last time to find out what they have been paid. Geri kicks off proceedings by demanding to know why Sarah and Luke did not want a return visit to Greenways of Malvern, before they in turn confront Sanjeev and Elinor over their low cleanliness score for Ferry Lodge. Then the Court Colman Manor proprietors accuse Sarah and Luke of unfairly judging their hotel, before the payments are revealed and the winners are announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Nicholas and Pauline Patch, a couple who have frequently holidayed on Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands and are now looking for a second home there. Armed with a budget of £125,000, she shows them around a range of potential properties.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Chris James and Susan Spencer from Norfolk find their dream waterfront holiday home in Tampa, Florida. The couple have a budget of £150,000, and are hoping to find a place their entire family will enjoy.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Sutton Courtenay, Oxfordshire, where aerial photography of an apparently featureless field reveals the site of a group of buildings once occupied by Anglo-Saxon royalty. They build up a picture of life 1,400 years ago, using clues including a piece of Saxon poetry and a totem pole.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the experts visit the remains of Hopton Castle in Shropshire, where they try to combine contemporary accounts and their own archaeological findings to produce an unbiased account of an English Civil War battle that took place there in 1644. The team also searches for evidence that could reveal the true fate of the defeated Parliamentary soldiers who had been trying to defend the castle.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller teams up with specialist orthopaedic surgeon Dr Michael Hamilton to see if there is anything they can do to give a Border collie a happier, more comfortable life.(n)

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a couple planning to transform a 1960s ambulance into a campervan, and an artist who has commissioned a giant wooden floating egg to use as a work and living space. He also discovers a novel way of turning a suburban basement in Nottingham into an aquarium, and begins his own project to create a fantasy tree house in the grounds of the Kielder National Park in Northumberland.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: In 2003 Gil and Hillary Briffa decided to retire to southern Spain, where they planned to build a contemporary home in the Andalusian hills against the backdrop of more traditional properties. A few years later, Gil died, but now Kevin McCloud revisits Hillary to find out whether her residence has settled into its landscape and how life is treating her as a British widow living abroad.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: GP Zewlan Moor and her electrician husband Tom Naulty, who is now a stay-at-home dad to their two children, set out to build an architect-designed house on a shoestring budget.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Sarah Millican and Humphrey Ker. programme.title: Drain the Ocean
programme.desc: Below the surface of the Earth's oceans lies a mysterious and relatively unknown world. With a diversity of life that rivals the rainforest, the ocean is one of the world's largest ecosystems, but relatively little is known about what lives in its great depths. Drain the Ocean draws on the latest scientific knowledge and uses CGI animation to remove the water, revealing a landscape of unimaginable scale - with underwater mountain ranges long enough to stretch round the world one and a half times - and with tens of thousands of mud volcanoes and other features that are more dynamic than anything found on land(n)

programme.title: Henry Danger

programme.title: The Thundermans

programme.title: The Thundermans
programme.desc: No Country for Old Mentors. Phoebe joins a mentor program and gets paired with her dad, but she laments this match up because her father uses antiquated superhero methods(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.sub-title: The Devil Made Me Do It
programme.desc: The Devil Made Me Do It. When she is caught playing with Jesse's recording equipment, Michelle is punished by Danny (Bob Saget). Feeling that the penalty is unfair, Michelle runs away and winds up at the home of her best friend Teddy (Tahj Mowry), where she meets his somewhat nutty sister Denise (a role played by young Mowry's real-life twin sisters)played by child actor Mowry's real-life sisterlactor Mhecdcen. Meanwhile, in her efforts to mediate a quarrel between Kimmy (Andrea Barber) and Steph (Jodie Sweetin), DJ (Candace Cameron) loses her cool. In addition to sharing the role of Michelle, twins Ashley Olsen and Mary-Kate Olsen appear together as the "Good" and "Evil" sides of Michelle's conscience(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Driving Ms. D.J. D.J. gets her learner's permit, but Danny drives her crazy with all his instructions. Rita: Maria Cavaiani. Rebecca: Lori Loughlin. Danny: Bob Saget. Jesse: John Stamos. Joey: Dave Coulier(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Yours, Mine and Ours. Jesse and Rebecca each imagine how the other's parenting techniques may affect the twins in the future. Meanwhile, Danny takes Joey and the girls out for "Family Fun Night"(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: The Trouble with Danny. It's time for the traditional Spring Cleaning Day, and everyone in the Tanner household--except Michelle (played by the Olsen twins)--is dreading the prospect of neat-freak Danny (Bob Saget) forcing them to go to work. When the family rebals against Danny's overzealousness, he decides to radically change his ways. Unfortunately (and predictably), Danny the Slob proves to be even more obnoxious than Danny the Neat(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with Rachel's Going-Away Party
programme.desc: The One with Rachel's Going-Away Party. The gang plans a going-away party for Rachel, but rather than face them together she offers each a private goodbye, but one of the guys takes it the wrong way when he's excluded. Also, Monica prepares for life in the suburbs and she and Chandler keep a watchful eye on the mother of their future adopted child(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The Last One. In the last ever episode, Ross wants to be with Rachel, but she still wants to go to Paris. Mike tells Phoebe that he wants to have babies. Ross and Phoebe chase Rachel to the airport so that Ross can declare his love for her. Meanwhile, Chandler and Monica finish packing for their move to the suburbs, and Joey loses Chick Jr and Duck Jr in the fussball table(n)

programme.title: Supergirl

programme.title: DC's Legends of Tomorrow

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Fish merchant Robert and his wife Kelly decide to open a seafood restaurant in Brixham - but their determinedly contemporary approach to cuisine leaves some locals unimpressed. The programme also follows the journey of a turbot over 36 hours, as it is caught and auctioned off before being served in an exclusive London restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: The cameras follow three teams of fishermen participating in Brixham's annual Trawler Race, including a father and son who have been pitted against each other. Landlady Pat Seddon is not looking forward to the raucous celebrations, however, and decides to reminisce about past race days instead. The programme also meets Matt Kimble, a graduate who gave up on his plan to become a PE teacher and decided to follow his ancestors into the fishing trade instead.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: President Bartlet continues the Press leak investigation to find out how information about the military shuttle became common knowledge. CJ is interviewed by White House counsel, Donna asks Josh for a job and Santos questions his choice of Leo as running mate. Martin Sheen and Bradley Whitford star.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: A grand jury is convened to investigate the military shuttle leak, and Vinick is in charge of smoothing things over as the campaign's focus switches to national security. programme.title: Without a Trace

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

Crime drama, starring William Petersen.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods

It is up to Danny to discover what the victims have in common and who is responsible. Meanwhile, Frank helps an old friend come to terms with his alcoholism. Starring Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor discovers some of the hidden extras on offer in the world's most expensive hotels. He goes underground at Paris's George V for a tasting session in its fine wine cellars and catches up with the managing director of London's Goring, who reveals why the hotel has become the unofficial royal choice. At the Hotel Bel-Air in Los Angeles, Richard talks to a wedding planner who has organised nuptials for celebrities including Gwen Stefani, Nicole Richie and Katy Perry, and he also chats to Kiss bassist Gene Simmons and Cosmopolitan editor-in-chief Joanna Coles.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace

programme.desc: Holmes is conducting research in a hospital morgue when he stumbles upon a string of murders, crimes that went undetected by the staff as the victims were all weak or terminally ill. programme.desc: The team races to a playground where a boy has slipped and broken his arm.(n)

programme.title: The Real A&E
programme.desc: Staff members treat a 72-year-old who fell off his bike and into a greenhouse, and a motorcyclist who was riding without a helmet.(n)

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Holmes investigates a plane crash and shocks his colleagues when his sharp eye discerns one of the victims died before the aircraft hit the ground - indicating it was murder rather than an accident. Meanwhile, Watson has a difficult task trying to uncover Sherlock's sentimental side as she attempts to reunite him with his father. Crime drama, starring Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Following the sudden death of BAU Section Chief Erin Strauss, there's an air of uncertainty among the team, with Hotch tipped to take her place. However, before a decision is made, there's a case in need of immediate attention - the bodies of two women have been found in Arizona, both shot in the heart and made to look like they are praying.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents hold a delusional man in custody for the multiple murders of women who have cheated on their partners, but the discovery of the suspect's doppelganger forces a major re-evaluation of their investigation. Guest starring Camryn Manheim and Fred Koehler.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team investigates when a sniper strikes just days before the anniversary of JFK's death, and it is suspected the attack is a result of the killer's obsession with the former president. Meanwhile, a visiting agent turns up to help solve the case. Guest starring CSI: Miami's Eva LaRue, with Joe Mantegna.(n)

programme.title: Trapped in Paradise
programme.desc: Three bungling brothers manage to pull off a major robbery in a backwoods community on Christmas Eve, but the unwitting locals make them feel so welcome they find it impossible to leave town, leaving the crooks facing a crisis of conscience. Offbeat comedy, starring Nicolas Cage, Dana Carvey, Jon Lovitz and Madchen Amick.(n)

programme.title: Rock the Kasbah
programme.desc: A has-been rock manager is left stranded in war-torn Kabul after his last remaining client abandons him. He meets a local teenager who has dreams of becoming a pop star, and tries to make her the first female contestant on a TV talent show, assisted by a prostitute, a mercenary and a couple of war profiteers. Comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Leem Lubany, Bruce Willis, Kate Hudson and Zooey Deschanel.(n)

programme.title: Scouts Guide To The Zombie Apocalypse
programme.desc: Three boy scouts look forward to spending their last camping trip together. However, they soon have a more pressing need for their wilderness survival skills when their home town is overrun with the walking dead. Fortunately, a tough cocktail waitress is on hand to help the youngsters survive the zombie onslaught. Comedy horror, starring Tye Sheridan, Logan Miller and Joey Morgan.(n)

programme.title: When Harry Met Sally
programme.desc: A man and a woman with different attitudes to life meet by chance and develop a close and long-lasting friendship. But over time, a mutual sexual attraction begins to develop and threatens to ruin their relationship - raising the question whether men and women can ever really be just friends. Romantic comedy, starring Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Calamity ensues when two party-loving brothers attempt to find respectable dates for their sister's Hawaii wedding. Comedy, starring Zac Efron and Anna Kendrick.(n)

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Fun with Dick and Jane
programme.desc: A highly paid executive loses everything after his corrupt boss's false accounting ruins the firm and leaves him to take the blame. Flat-broke and with no income or savings to maintain his lavish lifestyle, he and his wife decide the only way to support themselves is to turn to crime. Remake of the 1976 comedy, with Jim Carrey, Tea Leoni, Alec Baldwin and Richard Jenkins.(n)

programme.title: Zoolander 2
programme.desc: A dim-witted supermodel must step back into the spotlight and save the day when someone starts murdering pop stars. Comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Calamity ensues when two party-loving brothers attempt to find respectable dates for their sister's Hawaii wedding. Comedy, starring Zac Efron and Anna Kendrick.(n)

programme.title: Knocked Up
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.(n)

programme.title: Grimsby
programme.desc: Two brothers are separated at birth, the younger growing up to be MI6's top agent while the older becomes a layabout football hooligan. When they are finally reunited, the dim-witted elder sibling ends up helping his brother foil an evil plan that threatens the entire world. Action comedy, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Mark Strong and Rebel Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
programme.desc: A Kazakhstani journalist is sent to the United States to learn about the country and its customs. However, when the inquisitive reporter stumbles across an episode of Baywatch featuring Pamela Anderson, he becomes convinced she is his future bride and embarks on a reckless mission to track her down. Spoof documentary, starring Sacha Baron Cohen, Ken Davitian and Pamela Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Frustrated heavy metal band the Lone Rangers are determined to get air time for their new record and take a radio station hostage to ensure it happens. Comedy, starring Steve Buscemi, Brendan Fraser, Adam Sandler and Michael McKean.(n)

programme.title: What About Bob
programme.desc: A psychiatrist takes on a friend's client, who turns out to be a well-meaning but annoying neurotic barely able to leave his home. The patient is hugely impressed by the consultant's methods, leading him to follow the therapist on holiday, where he unwittingly proceeds to make his life hell while winning over his family. Comedy, starring Bill Murray, Richard Dreyfuss, Julie Hagerty and Charlie Korsmo.(n)

programme.title: Gremlins
programme.desc: A teenager is given a strange, cute creature as a Christmas present by his eccentric father and warned to keep it away from water, not to feed it after midnight, or expose it to direct light. However, a chance dousing causes the furball to spawn a horde of murderous little monsters, and their devilish antics bring mayhem to a small town. Comedy horror, with Zach Galligan, Phoebe Cates, Hoyt Axton and Polly Holliday.(n)

programme.title: Breaking the Bank
programme.desc: A family-run British bank attracts the attention of ruthless Japanese and American corporations determined to buy them out. The incompetent chairman faces a struggle to save the business as well as his own marriage. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, Tamsin Greig, John Michael Higgins and Andrew Sachs.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Bad News Bears
programme.desc: A washed-up and embittered baseball player struggles with bad memories of a failed sports career. When his exasperated lawyer suggests he coach a losing Little-League team, he begins to turn himself and the youngsters into a force to be reckoned with. Richard Linklater's remake of the 1970s comedy, starring Billy Bob Thornton, Greg Kinnear, Marcia Gay Harden and Emmanuel Estrada.(n)

programme.title: Mr Right
programme.desc: A woman falls for what she thinks is an ideal guy, but he turns out to be a hitman on the run from the crime cartels who employ him. Action comedy, starring Anna Kendrick, Sam Rockwell and Tim Roth.(n)

programme.title: Get a Job
programme.desc: Two college graduates faced with the prospect of deciding what to do with their lives find themselves faced with a more immediate crisis - getting and keeping a job. Their search for employment takes them through a succession of strange experiences and even stranger workplaces. Comedy, starring Miles Teller, Anna Kendrick, Bryan Cranston and Alison Brie.(n)

programme.title: The Bad Education Movie
programme.desc: Incompetent teacher Alfie Wickers decides his students deserve a treat for somehow passing their GCSEs, so decides to take them on the greatest school trip of their lives - to Cornwall. However, a series of disasters leaves the class into trouble with suspicious locals. Comedy, starring Jack Whitehall, Harry Enfield and Iain Glen.(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: Years after being humiliated as a student, rogue CIA agent Robbie Wheirdicht turns to old classmate Calvin Joyner for help when he's targeted by his own organisation. Action comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart and Amy Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Pooh's Grand Adventure: The Search for Christopher Robin
programme.desc: Christopher Robin starts school and leaves a note for Winnie the Pooh explaining why he will not be around any more. However, the bear misunderstands the message and becomes convinced his friend is in grave danger, organising the other animals into a rescue attempt. Animated adventure, with the voices of Jim Cummings and John Fiedler.(n)

programme.title: Ratatouille
programme.desc: A rat finds his love of fine food has made him an outcast to his less discerning family. Separated from his fellow rodents by a storm, he winds up in a famous French restaurant, where he helps an incompetent kitchen assistant become the greatest chef in Paris. Pixar animated comedy from the director of The Incredibles, with the voices of Patton Oswalt, Ian Holm, Lou Romano and Peter O'Toole.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)

programme.title: Finding Dory
programme.desc: Nemo and dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents. Animated sequel, with the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Finding Nemo
programme.desc: Clownfish Nemo becomes separated from his friends on the Great Barrier Reef - but the thrill of being able to swim freely and away from his overprotective father turns to horror when he is netted by a diver. His distraught dad sets out on a mission to find him, while the youngster finds himself in a dentist's tropical tank. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Albert Brooks, Ellen DeGeneres, Alexander Gould, Willem Dafoe, Barry Humphries and Geoffrey Rush.(n)
